name: Temple Square
address: 50 N Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84150, USA
reviews: Christmas-time is one of the best times to come and visit Temple Square.  They always have nativities set up as a tribute to other nations, and the grounds are decorated nicely.  I know that in the upcoming years, as they do construction on the Salt Lake Temple, that the grounds will not have nearly the same amount of lights and display as they have had recently, but that's alright.  Just make sure that you plan appropriately.  The grounds are beautiful and they always have flowers or lights or something that is seasonally appropriate going on.  A nice quiet area in the heart of the city to eat lunch and ponder on life.

I love everything about Temple Square! We went to see the lights turn on for the Christmas season. It was so magical! The sister missionaries were singing beautiful Christmas hymns on the steps of the Tabernacle. I always get teary while viewing the Nativity and listening to the story of Christ's birth. One of my favorite parts is visiting the Christus in the North Visitors Center. My daughter was also able to perform with her school choir in the Assembly Hall. Temple Square is a must for the Christmas Season.

Just incredible. Beautiful, peaceful and spiritual atmosphere. The architecture and plants and layout of temple square are breathtaking. There is lots of space and green grass and fountains and big sidewalks, along with good food and shopping very nearby. Highly recommend spending a day to check everything out.

I've always loved this place.  It is a beautiful building and the grounds are immaculate.  I always feel at peace here and love to walk around looking at the various buildings and monuments.  There are tons of thing to explore from the history of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints to geneology and family history.  The architecture is inspiring and much of the history of the area has been preserved.

Great place to be during the winter with Christmas lights and also during other times of the year. The gardens are beautiful and even if you are not a member of the Church of Jesus Christ of latter day saints there are things to do. Cool musical events and interesting museums that explain the culture and church's history.

name: Salt Lake Temple
address: 50 N West Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84150, USA
reviews:
What a beautiful temple. This is by far the most impressive temple I have been to. The artwork and decorations inside and out are simply amazing and breathtaking. 
When we think that this building was built in a time when Salt Lake City was but a small city out in the middle of nowhere, to see how much effort the pioneers put forth to glorify God!

Of course not everyone is allowed inside the temple but you can roam around the place for its beauty and architecture. Located in the center of downtown, this place depicts the Mormon culture and religion. You can park in the city center mall and walk around the place. Prayer hall is open to all which is in-fact  the most beautiful prayer halls I have ever seen. It’s grandeur is amazing.

Splendid architecture and this place gives a good insight in to the Mormon culture. I would recommend spending time in the adjacent Mormon museum which explains the origins of their travels west in to Utah in 1800’s. I tried booking their tour in their HQ but the slots were fully booked. Always loved their missionary zeal when I came upon Mormons from US in Bangalore, they even took public buses and always travel in pairs.

Always such a place of peace and comfort. I love the salt lake temple and how beautiful it is inside and outside. It's breathtaking. My husband and I were sealed there in December and even though it was insanely busy, we were shown where to go and there was always someone there to answer our questions. Such a beautiful place and can't wait till it opens again.

The Salt Lake Temple is always a beautiful place to visit in Downtown Salt Lake City. The grounds are quiet and serene, and you can really meditate about life in a place like this. Remember, it is closed for the next 4-5 years - so all you really get to do is come down here and look at the construction as it is renovated... but when it is open, it's a great place to be.

name: Land Cruiser Heritage Museum
address: 470 W 600 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: This place is outstanding!  I’ve been to quite a few car museums in my life, this one ranks near the top. I look forward to returning. I believe they currently have 95 Land Cruisers from 1955-2020. I’ve always admired the Land Cruiser, and hope to have another some day. They had so many variants from all over the world. How they’ve been able to put together such an extraordinary collection is beyond me. On top of all the vehicles, they have a huge collection of literature and memorabilia. Not to mention a fantastic docent.

I had been waiting to go here for over two years. I was not disappointed. The location is clean and extremely well organized. The staff are friendly and very helpful. My friends and I had an awesome time enjoying their collection of almost 100 Land Cruisers. They are going to have updates to the collection by mid May!

What a gem of a museum. My wife & two young kids had a wonderful time inside. So much fun history and so many beautiful makes and models to drool over. 

The staff is so friendly and helpful and know everything about these vehicles. 

Don’t sleep on the cool schwag. This is a really well done automotive museum. 

We will be coming back!

This place is truly epic! A land cruiser fan's heaven.  Mad Matt was on site filming while I was there, he was saying he needed two days to take it all in. I only had an hour before my flight but I will be back.  Got to talk to Dan on some repair advice.  Very well set up and all trucks have an info placard.  They also have toys and models of cruisers that are rare.

Amazing inventory and so cool to see all different models of Toyota vehicles from over the years and around the world! Crazy how the vehicles are held up in such a great condition! Definitely worth checking out!!!

name: Hogle Zoo
address: 2600 Sunnyside Ave S, Salt Lake City, UT 84108, USA
reviews: It’s a smaller zoo compared to eastern zoos, but it’s the best in Utah. They do have a lot of nice exhibits and it is really fun to go. There was a baby monkey in one of the exhibits and the elephants were especially photogenic. It wasn’t too busy and took a few hours. My younger siblings loved it. It’s not too expensive. Very fun!!

I have been coming here since I was little and the zoo just keeps improving the quality for the animals and also for the guests. I really love the interactive displays for the kids and think that it really is the best way to get them hooked on conservation. I think that the zoo could do better at having feeding times, also having more of the animals that kids can touch and have an awesome experience with. The Natural History Museum has the spiders, centipedes, and cockroaches that they have crawl on you if you are willing and the kids loved it. Hope to see some more awesome changes! Keep it up!

A fun little zoo to visit. We visited before we had to fly back it took about 2 hours to go through the whole zoo at a leisurely pace. 

One of the few zoos that I've been to that has a art gallery you can pick up some very awesome and unique art.

I definitely recommend coming here if you need to kill some time between plans.

We love our zoo pass! Go at off peak hours and through the fall, winter, and spring months for less crowds. Today when we went it was a little snowy (in March), but the animals were very active and there was only a handful of other people there. If you have a pass avoid the free days because it gets a little crazy. During the summer my kids love the playground and splash pad. They also love the bird show.

Beautiful zoo! Spacious, clean, and features a wonderful variety of species. Nice to walk through the whole zoo. Everybody has large exhibits and enough space. The harbour seal show was amazing as well, and it was great finding a place where the seals could participate in the show (instead of just the sea lions) and the seals looked like they enjoyed it. The viewing area for the zebras and giraffes was gorgeous, and they had loads of space. The gift shop was also beautiful. One of my favorite zoos, and I hope to visit again!

name: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints Conference Center
address: 60 N Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84150, USA
reviews:
Must visit place even if you believe in religion or not, when you are in SLC. The volunteer are extremely patient and will give you a free guided tours. Though you can roam around the four floor building on your own, there are certain areas where you need a volunteer to enter. Try going to all the floors. The auditorium they have within the building is huge with 21k seating capacity. Its simply stunning. Also, on the 3rd floor they have a mini display of temple square showing whats it like inside the actual temple. 
Highly recommended!!!

The staff & hosts here were wonderful and incredibly knowledgeable. They are passionate about what they're doing and loved receiving questions. The establishment was quite beautiful and has a lot of story to it! I highly recommend getting a tour!

The Conference Center is an enormous example of stunning architecture and original paintings and statuary. The hosts are friendly and helpful. Best of all is the peace and beauty. There is such an uplifting feeling.

Special experience to finally visit the place i have only seen on a screen for 24 years 😍 all worth the travel. Wish everyone will experience a similar feeling of reaching destination goals that have personal value. If this is one of them I hope you'll go!

I love the conference center! It is a peaceful, beautiful place.  If you are visiting from out of town you should take a tour.  It is free and there are volunteers that will show you around.   There is a rooftop garden with water features as well where you can get good views and sit and relax.

name: Red Butte Garden
address: 300 Wakara Way, Salt Lake City, UT 84108, USA
reviews:
Great place to visit in the spring, summer, and fall, if you like native plants to Utah. It is a very big garden with many paved trails. Most all of the plants, shrubs, vines, and trees have descriptive markers.

 During the spring and summer you can purchase plants here.

Also during the summer months you can go to live concerts of many quality musicians here, which is an awesome venue. But get your tickets early on most shows before they sell out.

I love the concert series that they have here.  They allow you to bring in your own food and your own alcohol and the band selection is always really cool. The outdoors during the summer is pleasant and makes the atmosphere really fun.

This large stretch of land is absolutely gorgeous! If you want to take an invigorating hike or just a peaceful stroll through the garden you can do both here. There is also an educational value to visiting Red Butte Garden; there are little signs that give the names of all the vegetation along with how much water and sunlight they need. They also have various opportunities for volunteers. 
The garden also hosts some concerts and seasonal events like Garden After Dark.
It's a great place for people of all ages.
Not to mention, it's a short walk to the neighboring Utah Museum of Natural History so you can go to one after visiting the other.

Red Butte Garden concerts are so enjoyable. It’s such a beautiful and quaint setting.   Concerts are relatively small so you don’t have to fight a huge crowd like you would at USANA amphitheatre.  There’s nothing better than listening to great music on a beautiful summer night at red Butte Garden amphitheater

Very beautiful botanical garden. There are a variety of gardens to explore, each featuring stunning yet pristine arrangements. Fantastic location for families, dates, and even weddings. Took my girlfriend as part of our anniversary celebration, and we loved it! Got some great photos and enjoyed the peaceful environment. Would highly recommend.

name: Natural History Museum of Utah
address: 301 Wakara Way, Salt Lake City, UT 84108, USA
reviews: This museum is fabulous and worth every penny. The diversity exhibits is incredible! The creativity behind each interactive explanation of the world we live in is truly impressive. A visit here is truly a treat and inspires one to learn more and care for the amazing world we live in.  Aside from the experience of walking through history and peeking into multiple branches of science, the employees were kind and bathrooms clean. You should definitely visit!

As a history nerd I LOVE this place. My daughter has had field trips multiple times here and I am at every one. We always come back as a family to spend more time and just explore it all in even more depth. There is so much to see and do while here that it truly could be an all day experience! They always tend to have a new exhibit every once in a while that keeps me wanting to come back and check it out.

So many cool exhibits and a great place to let your little one or “little one” at heart roam around and see all the neat things that Utah has to offer. Clearly the dinosaurs are pretty amazing but all of the different levels fun experiences that your family will love. If you are an employee or student of the University of Utah you get in for free. It’s a pretty sweet deal since the museum can get pretty expensive depending on how many people are in your group. While there we got to go into the archives which was pretty amazing. I’ll definitely be back.

A Fantastic Educational Experience
The NHMU is a fantastic museum. The variety of exhibits is amazing. From the history of the indigenous people, the dinosaur exhibits, how the Salt Lake was formed to the info about conservation and recycling. Everything was well presented and informative. One of the best exhibits was the observation deck on the roof. There is an amazing panoramic view of the Wasatch mountains and the Salt Lake valley.

We always enjoy a trip to the Natural History Museum.  It is a lovely museum in terms of architecture as well as in the lay out of the exhibits.  Great views of the city as well on a nice clear day when the upper terrace is open.  A great place to visit with kids if you are in town visiting or if you have family in town. 

Wednesdays are also a great deal where the museum stays open late and you can get a ticket after 5pm for $5!

name: Tracy Aviary
address: 589 E 1300 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84105, USA
reviews: Don't hesitate, just GO!!!  If you like birds, wildlife, or conservation this is the place for you.  They've got lots of cool exhibits with birds from all over the world and great, educational kids programs.  Located in Liberty Park so it's near other cool things too.

Lots of fun for a surprise date night. I love birds and it’s such a beautiful place, staff were all so friendly and you can tell they love their jobs! Definitely going back and scheduling one of their special events

I absolutely love visiting the Tracy Aviary. Their birds always look healthy and well taken care of. In addition to this the staff has always been informative and happy to educate about their flock. They represent the highest level of stewardship for the animals they care for.

This was so well worth the price of the visit (only $9!) and I could definitely see myself coming here again and again once it gets warmer! Every single bird was an absolute beauty to look at and the indoor exhibits with all of the plants are so swoon worthy.

It was snowing and cold when we visited, but still so much fun! It has been a while since the last visit and I forgot how many exhibits there are. The kea were playing in the snow and with their toys, and we went to the bird show which included an adorable painting parrot. Great activity, even with the snow!

name: Utah State Capitol Building
address: 350 State St, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews:
I’ve been in Utah 2 years now but never to the Capitol Building. Went today and loved it. The views, architecture, and Christmas tree were stunning. A bit freezing but we did peak at some of the grounds and can’t wait to come back in warmer weather. 
The rotunda area was incredible. There were no tours but we wandered around with the self guided tour and did just fine. Parking was convenient, just be prepared  to get a lot of steps in!

The view up here is breathtaking! Be sure to find the best spot avoiding trees distracting the views. You could see the mountain far away as well as the whole landscape of the city. Here're the pictures taken from the building.

Beautiful, clean grounds. Well kept. The inside of the capital of spectacular. We enjoyed the old fashioned elevators. The murals were beautiful and taught us the history of Utah. What a beautiful and ornate building. Outside of the capital you can find great views of the mountains and the City

Beautiful building and grounds.  Building is open until 6 so I went in after 5 and did a self guided tour.  Very peaceful after hours and better opportunities for pictures.  Rotunda depicts historic events of state history.  West wing has basic history of the building and state information.  Parking is free and tours are free.
Beautiful building with exquisite views that line up with the cities grid. Great place for a picnic or to catch a sunset.

name: Salt Lake Tabernacle
address: 50 N West Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84150, USA
reviews: Amazing place!!! Words alone can't possibly describe the experience. Please come and see for yourself—you'll love every second! I went to the organ recital and the music and spirit it brought was nothing short of amazing! The acoustics of this place are superb (you can literally hear a pin drop from the other side of the room). I love being here and can all but guarantee you will too!

What a beautiful historic and spiritual place to see.  The history of this place is amazing.  The building and pipes (organ pipes) are made from wood near my home in Southern Utah from what I've read.  I saw the Saints Unified Voices and another choir perform there (Polynesian choir) and it was one of my most memorable experiences in this building and possibly anywhere.  Glad it was in this building.

The acoustics are amazing! The choirs who preform here always sound amazing. If you like historical architecture than this is a great building to stop into while in Salt Lake as well. There is a lot of history on Temple Square and always someone, missionary or volunteer, to tell you about it. Try to catch music and the spoken word while they are in the Tabernacle as well, it's amazing. The organ is also wonderful. The degree of sound and movement that the really good organists have are amazing.

Beautiful building with very interesting history. 
We were there while an organ recital was going and had the opportunity to listen to an amazingly talented organist.  This place is great for people with little ones too, there is a room that you can go in and listen to the music if tour little one is being fussy.

Beautiful building, free to tour. Amazing organ! Lots of free events, especially musical events like organ recitals and music and the spoken word by the Tabernacle choir. The sound is amazing in the building. Definitely worth a visit!

name: Sugar House Park
address: 1330 2100 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84106, USA
reviews: Sugar House Park is really great place to go - especially with kids. There's a creek, a pond with geese and ducks and several awesome playgrounds. You can fly a kite, ride your bike, jog, or cross the creek on large logs. The park is awesome in all seasons - sledding in the winter is a popular activity. There are clean restrooms, drinking fountains and picnic tables with barbecue pits. Short but adventurous trail takes you to Sugar House Commons shops and restaurants.  I highly recommend it !

This park is a great place to learn how to drive your car.  However, be careful.  It's also a great place for young parents to teach their children how to ride a bike.  New car drivers, just like well seasoned drivers are fully liable for running over any and all pedestrians.  Please drive carefully.

Loved it! Lots of land for strolling. It was very spacious, had an amazing view of the surrounding Salt Lake City mountains! Very dog friendly! The goose pond has lots of poop around fyi but still very pretty

This is one of the biggest and most beautiful parks in and around salt lake city. There are a number of play grounds, walking tracks, picnic spots with seating arrangements, a big lake full of ducks. A number of parking areas around the park. During summer the park gives a look of  beautiful green contours and during winters when it snows the whole area becomes white all around and children's favourite place for sledding.

Great running trail! Good amount of foot traffic in the summer but always plenty of room on the trail. Plenty of parking all around the park and along the trail. Even in the summer when the fields are packed for activities. There’s 6 parking lots all along the trail as well. Great park all year round.

name: Church History Museum
address: 45 N West Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84150, USA
reviews:
One of the fun things about the museum is an original pioneer log house outside the front entrance. It was locked when we arrived, but when it's not (probably in warmer weather) you can step just inside the door and see the furnishings. We could tell that by looking in the window.
The museum is not large, but the two floors of exhibits are modern and attractively arranged, with a number of interactive features. There are plenty of volunteers on hand to answer questions.
I took my two sons, ages 12 and 5, hoping to see the special exhibit for children, but it doesn't reopen until Feb 12. There was, however, a room with a few toys and books, including some old fashioned pioneer toys. My boys spent 15 or 20 minutes each on a painting app on a screen mounted on an easel, and another 15 minutes with other items.
Then we walked through another exhibit I was interested in, but only for a few minutes because my 12 year old was ready to go. My 5 year old could have been happy for a while longer, I think, because there were so many things that caught his eye.
Ours was a short visit, and we didn't see much, but since it's free it wasn't a lost investment.
Another plus was the free parking behind the museum.

Although I am not Mormon,I went here just to learn about the History of Mormonism. It was wonderful! The museum is very well organized and the staff is incredibly helpful and will answer any questions without making you feel silly. They also had a women's suffrage section upstairs that was a pleasant surprise! Beautiful quilts and fabric work that you could spend days looking at.

What an amazing experience! I tell myself that I don't enjoy museums but after the fact I usually do. If you are a member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day saints or not, it will still be an enriching experience. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. It is free to experience and you don't need a reservation. You could spend 10 minutes or several hours here. There is something for the whole family, interactive displays, movies, artifacts, and some juicy facts! Have a wholesome time at the Church History Museum.

We were visiting from Texas and our hotel was just around the corner from us so we decided to check it out. This is a beautiful Museum, but most importantly, the people here were genuinely kind. We truly enjoyed our conversations with everyone we came in contact with. It was very educational. We highly recommend that you stop in and check it out!

Had an fun visit to this museum together with my family. We particularly enjoyed the women's suffrage exhibit, which was interesting and informative - I would never have guessed Utah was so early in passing legislation allowing women to vote. Convenient location with parking, and interesting exhibits for adults and children of all ages.

name: Memory Grove Park
address: 300 N Canyon Rd, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews: One of my favorite outdoor areas. It’s amazing for a hot day to get under some shade. Great for dogs that love water. They have open fields for your dog to run. Great for doggy dates! The trail does get a little slippery when wet or snowy so keep good footwear in mind.

Great for pictures during slow times of day, especially in the fall. Good off leash area for dogs on the north trails.

Only downside is no enforcement of "leashed" zones. My dog got best a few times here and some dog owners dont know how to responsible humans. 

Park is still great and well maintained.

Best location in Salt Lake City for trivial / non-original photos / brides / bands. There are about 10 different groups taking pictures now.
Amazing! Great space for walking or running. For those who are not from the city, here are the best running trails. 5 miles of asphalt, hill and beautiful nature!
It was a beautiful day for a stroll in the park. Lots of dogs in and if leash. Everyone was having a great time! It's well cared for & I enjoyed the memorial/history displays.

Beautiful neighborhood park with a huge off leash trail. 

We parked the vanabus on top of the hill, just across from the Capitol building. Then, walked down the trail. Easy walk down and up with paved trails. 

The park is beautiful, with a meditation building and a river. A great place to spend an afternoon exploring. Perfect stop for travelers like us!

name: Clark Planetarium
address: 110 400 W, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: Been here several times. There is always plenty to do free and even the shows are fairly cheap. Plus they are in 3d. How cool is that. If you love space like I do then I highly recommend this place. Or you are just starting your journey learning about space then you won't be disappointed. At least I wasn't.

What a great spot to visit while at the Gateway. I love that there is no charge for admission to the facility and the shows are pretty reasonably priced. My son and I love the interactive exhibits. I think it’s an awesome environment for people of all ages to learn and see something different. This is definitely a place that will bring out your inner child and keep your children captivated.

Super cool exhibits & it’s free!!! Can’t beat that! Just make sure you don’t come when there’s a field trip.... that was really annoying. Screaming kids everywhere and hard to see all of the exhibits. But tons of cool stuff to see, make sure you leave lots of time for it!

I enjoy this museum. Even at the age of 21, it allows me to have fun. A ton of different interactive displays and it’s all free. I haven’t tried the shows. The gift shop is good and has astronaut ice cream which is a childhood favorite for me. It wasn’t super expensive either. If you’re looking for a fun way to spend the day with the kids I highly recommend it.

Love this place! Fun exhibits, interesting games, great shows! I always enjoy myself when I visit the planetarium. The only downside is that the staff selling movie tickets seem to change policy every time I visit. Sometimes they'll let you in if you're 2 minutes late, other times they won't. But if you're on time for the show that'll never be a concern. 

Anyways, 10 out of 10, would recommend.

name: Salt Lake City Tours
address: 230 W 200 S #4874, Salt Lake City, UT 84110, USA
reviews: I'm very glad I took this tour. I found it on Google looking for a good downtown tour. This was a great way to see a lot of the interesting parts of Salt Lake City in a short amount of time, and there was so much to see that it was actually a very good value for the money. The guide was full of information and humor so it was a very enjoyable experience.

Terrific tour of Salt Lake City, 6 stars! Great Salt Lake tour was good but maybe just 4 stars. Overall I rate 5 stars for both tours then. Not much to see at Great Salt Lake but I give credit to my guide for trying very hard to make it as interesting as possible. Without him the lake would’ve been a complete bust. So at least he made it informative and somewhat fun. The City tour was outstanding though!

Just finished our Explorers tour of Temple Square in Salt Lake City and wanted to give a big shout out to our awesome tour guide, Chris! He was fantastic! We didn't expect much from Salt Lake City as we're just passing through on our way back from Yellowstone and on to the national parks. This tour ended up being a highlight of our trip thus far! Chris had a lot of great stories and factoids to share about the buildings and culture. He really seems knows his stuff and have a passion for what he does! A gentle soul who was very concerned about answering the questions posed by those in our group. Great experience and highly recommend it!

I enjoyed the tour this past Sunday. It was a great way to see all the downtown sights without having to wander an unfamiliar city. Our guide was fun, humorous, and very informative. The tour covered lots of things and we even got to hear the Tabernacle Choir and the famous pipe organ. I liked that the tour left just the right amount of time to see things.

Excellent guide gave a great narration. We never would've known what to see or seen so much on our own. The "souvenir photos" were a nice touch. I wasn't too interested in that aspect when reading up on their website but now I'm glad we have them, they're of very good quality and didn't add much to the cost.

name: Cathedral of the Madeleine
address: 331 E S Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this Cathedral!!! I come here whenever I need solitude to pray and can sit in their candle room, light a candle for someone and then pray for them or pray for my own strength. Such beautiful stained glass, you can also walk into the chapel and sit and pray ... everyone is very respectful and quiet. Sometimes they play the organ and sometimes they start a ceremony (in English or Spanish). I'm not a Catholic but i still find comfort in coming here to pray and find hope.

They have one of the most beautiful Catholic choirs I have ever heard.  When the Bishop is present for services, usually holidays, he fills the church with laughter and it is lovely.  This cathedral is not a typical looking cathedral in the sense that it does not have intricate stone carvings, or gold leaf everywhere, instead it is fairly modest looking in both size and aesthetics.  However, the people and the choir easily make up for the lack of sparkle in the church.  The choir is angelic and brings me to tears every time as it is spiritually moving in a big way.    I do wish they had weekday noon mass.  In Denver, I went to noon mass at the cathedral almost everyday and it helped me through some really difficult times.  I wish that they would do that in SLC.  I get that the Mormons are a huge part of the population, but we should have at least one church that offers this type of service for those of us that chose to spend lunch hour in the house of God.  Even if it was just once a week on Wednesday, it would be better than nothing.  I highly recommend attending high mass so that you can celebrate your faith through the incredible choir.  It is life changing, soul lifting, and they will make you want to jump out of the pew and applause like crazy.
Nice stop if you are around the neighborhood. Wouldn’t go out of your way to go here. It is a great experience when you get to go inside. Great architectural wonder.

I grew up in this church, and it's simply beautiful. The congregation is gracious and friendly and the singer does the songs/mass beautifully. The priest speaks a little daddy and i missed things at times but i enjoyed the mass altogether.

I worked her for a few years way back. It’s changed. Went for Adoration of the blessed Sacrament then fail Mass at 5:15p. The priest is young and very good. He seems very spiritual. The place was dirty. The public restrooms were very dirt. I saw a few cockroaches going along the floor.

name: The Leonardo Museum
address: 209 E 500 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: Very cool! I went to see the Pompeii exhibit earlier this year, the first time I had ever been to the Leonardo. I was pleased with my experience! The Pompeii exhibit was well thought out, informative, and my ticket included access to the rest of the museum as well. I loved the flight exhibit - they had a flight simulator that was very cool. The top floor had exhibits that taught about design and music, which was also pretty awesome. What a great way to spend your Saturday!

I've been here quite a few times, always for the featured exhibits and a couple of times for the adults wine and dine events. It's always fun, informative and the exhibits are always very good.
They have some different classes for adults and children that you can take part in, and while I haven't done any, they sound fun and I need to get back and try them.
They also have a little gift shop that sells educational stuff and of course items from the featured exhibit. As well as coffee, soda's, wine and food.
You can take your chance on street parking or just park in the libraries underground car park, which connects to the Leonardo. For me this is much easier and what I personally recommend.
If you're looking for something different, educational or just want to get out and do something. I'd recommend the Leonardo!

My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the Pompeii exhibit at the Leonardo. We were in Pompeii, Italy last year and toured the ruined city but all the artifacts had long since been removed and were displayed elsewhere. It was fascinating to see things like the bowls and plates they ate off of, the jewelry they wore, the artwork from their homes, the statues, and hear descriptions of much of what was on display with the audio equipment. The grand finale of the tour is poignant and touching. Well worth the price.

We went to see the Pompeii exhibit. It was amazing. The price was reasonable and the pieces were breathtaking. The history and audio was great. What an amazing and sad part of history brought to our little state. Thank you!

We saw the airplane exhibit and the Pompeii exhibit. I love museums and this one was just okay. Great subject matter but left a little bit to be desired. The plaques for information and audio tour devices were quite often so low or in odd places that they were easily missed when there is a crowd. (I'm 5' 7") I did like the video of the 3D models of the inside of the homes of Pompeii.

name: Utah Museum of Fine Arts
address: 410 Campus Center Dr, Salt Lake City, UT 84112, USA
reviews: Gorgeous space with all kinds of art from ancient, to island, to modern. We went on one of the museum's free days and it wasn't crowded at all. While I loved seeing the European sections, my kids enjoyed the African and Egyptian sections. We also sat entranced through the making art movie

Really nice museum. Big enough to spend a couple of hours but not overwhelming. We saw the whole thing in about 1.5 hours, taking our time. They've got a good variety and it's very well curated, with great, thought provoking signs by the artwork. I've never seen museum signs that asked questions of the viewer! Also all signs were in Spanish and English, which is awesome. Too few museums are bilingual. Keep up the great work Utah Museum of Fine Arts!
This place was great. It's a lot bigger than I thought it would be, and has several different galleries with different themes. Really fun time, will be back!

Lovely place.  It is not as large as some cities' but it still has a great variety of artwork from all over the world on display. The variety held my children's interests as each room had a separate theme.  There is a cute interactive kids corner on the second floor that captured my young children's imaginations with musical instruments and building blocks.

It’s so pretty, and the place has good atmosphere. It’s best on days where it’s not crowded because you can spend time admiring the art and the small spaces where they have religious statues. I love the tour guides too they take time to explain symbols and the importance of each piece. Best place in UT!

name: Ensign Peak Trailhead
address: Ensign Peak Trail, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews: This site was recommended by a local. Wonder  views of the entire down town of salt lake city. About 200 degrees of stunning mountain views. Two separate view points. Didnt make the top one due to mud. But ultimately enjoyed the light hike.

Don't miss this if you do d yourself here. It's a little steep and does not half a cement path but it's a very clear pathway. It's a little muddy still because of the weather but it's very scenic. You can stop on the way up for a breath and always have a good view. This is half way up and at the top! It's well worth the walk. Bring a backpack with some snacks stay up there a while. Check out the monuments on the way up! Very neat, lots of information and a good place to sit down and think, meditate if that's your thing. It's kinda windy at the top so prepare for that. 🌞

It took me years to finally visit this beautiful spot. I'm so glad I finally went! It's a steep hike, but worth it! The trial head is really nice. After that much of it isn't paved. After storms it can get kind of rough.

What an awesome place to be! Climbing the peak is about a 10-15 minute hike depending on your fitness. I made a few rest stops en route to the top. At the top the view overlooking the Salt Lake Valley is breathtaking. My friend took along a fairly powerful scope and we were able to get close up views of prominent icons in the city. It was an amazing experience.

Standing atop Ensign peak is a monument in honour of Latter-Day Saint pioneers who were instrumental in settling and developing the Salt Lake Valley back in the 1800's.
It was a short but awsome hike. The view was great. My only concern is that it was too steep for my children.

name: The Beehive House
address: 67 E S Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84150, USA
reviews: It was a very enlightening experience. The missionaries are so knowledgeable and insightful. I recommend it to anyone visiting the area. I've been living here for months and finally walked across the street. Should have done it earlier. I had a great time and learned a lot. Their historical memorabilia is to die for. Will be back with more time and bring friends next time.

I have lived in Utah 20+ years and FINALLY did the tour. So worth it to learn more about the early settlers. If a big group (over 10), get a reservation ahead of time, otherwise you can pop in any time and get a tour. Tours are about 30 minutes, but they'll spend more time with you if you ask questions. Grateful that this gem has been preserved over the century!

Oh my goodness! The quality of this tour has grown 10O0% better now that the Church history department has taken the reigns from the missionary department.

I highly recommend this. You get the historical aspects of the home and of the period. Polygamy is not hidden or glossed over, but stated as a matter of fact way of life. 

The guides are knowledgeable and accurate and there is no missionary pressure or out of the blue testifying that can turn off non-members who are there for the history and asking members for referrals of their friends which has been a guilt-ridden staple of historical sites in the past. 

Such a pleasant and professional change!

A fun free educational tour of Brigham Young's home and the beginning of Salt Lake City. The tour starts every 30 minutes with the last one at 530pm. It is not long and kid friendly. I recommend it to anyone religious or not as a great history lesson.

Loved the tour. It is done by guides now who know their history and we are able to get a feel about what it would be like to live there back in the day and the busy lifestyle they all had. Tour was nice and quick and they were able to  get through quickly since we were on a tight schedule.

name: Gilgal Sculpture Garden
address: 749 E 500 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84102, USA
reviews: The only downside to this place is you can tell the homeless have started camping here which takes away from the beauty. Wish they'd at least clean up after themselves. In every other way though this place is amazing i walked in not knowing what to expect when i accidentally found the park. The sculptures are amazing and i love how they depict the prophecies inscripted below them from the scriptures.

It's a cool place, if only it had descriptions of each statue, to get a better understanding of what the whole place is about. I like all the Scriptures, I could not figure out what some of the sculptures or statues, no description. Overall, really cool place
Definitely a unique place to visit! I wish there was more information about the pieces abs the garden. Also, super tiny, so if you're traveling just to see it, combine it with another activity.
What a great little Park hidden in downtown very cool sculptures not very big but very pleasant and quiet nice place to sit and relax definitely recommend to go to wish it was a little bigger though

While I would not consider it a MUST SEE, it is free and in the middle of the city.  I would give it 3.5 stars if I could.  It’s a unique experience for sure.  If you are in the area and have a few min to wander, I think it’s worth your time and stroll into the gates and give a look around.

name: Salt Lake City Public Library
address: 210 E 400 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: This library is pretty awesomely huge and really fun to walk around in! The  bottom level has cute little shops and snack options. The rooftop was unfortunately closed when I went but I'll definitely be coming back to see it and roam the shelves again!
My favorite library is in a small town in CT, this place a really big. I lost my child here. There were books on how to handle that. Nice people though!

This library was awesome! The atrium is beautiful and you can take a glass elevator to the top floor and see everything below. You can go up to the roof where there is a rooftop garden and path that has been and seating. There is a great view of the skyline from there. The children's section is great with little alcoves in the wall where they can sit and read. Coffee, pastries, and hot chocolate can be purchased inside the atrium on the main floor and there are plenty of places to study.
I like how phallic the foliage is!...🤔  Backup on GPS and take a look at the landscaping along 300 east... I wonder who signed off on that landscaping design?   "Frank and beans" 😅

Quiet clean and beautiful. Good food 
A lot of homeless people. 😢

name: Pioneer Memorial Museum
address: 300 Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews: AMAZING...did not have time to see everything due to being part of a field trip.  Definitely returning and taking my whole family. Printing out the scavenger hunt form and questions was so fun!!

My Dad and I spent hours on this building. Many of the pioneer tools used for blacksmithing were the same tools his father used. It was an awesome walk down memory lane for him. He also saw exhibits of floor installation tools that were like the ones he had used, only older. It was awesome. No photography allowed.
This place is fun to walk around and learn about Utah's roots. The museum contains pioneer artifacts that are interesting and nostalgic.

This museum was surprisingly cool. Especially downstairs. They've got some really cool artifacts. Once you do the basement and first floor the rest felt kind of redundant... The hair wreaths were kind of creepy.
I loved every minute I was there. This museum is awesome, and the price is right.

name: Liberty Park
address: 600 East 900 South, Salt Lake City, UT 84105, USA
reviews: It was so much fun, to s of different parks for big and little kids, musical instruments put out to play with, kid proof, and tons of dogs. There is also lots of space for the dogs to roam around, the grass is perfect for picnic part. It also has tables, if u prefer not to eat of the floor. There is a ton of cool stuff to educate your kids with too. You can teach them how people found N, S, E, and W on one of the first ever compass, or tell time on the first clock ever made! You can fun around and play tag for age's, it's the perfect park for many occasions. I highly recommend it!

This park is the biggest park in salt lake city. The bird aviary is one of the main attraction here.
There are a number of grounds suitable for outdoor games, a large duck pond and specific areas for picnics with seating arrangements. 
There are tall trees and beautiful lush green grass contours. A series of walk ways connects various grounds and other areas.
There is ample parking area.

It was a pretty cold, wintery day when we went to Liberty park but we still had a lot of fun. There is a nice mix of play equipment, paths, green spaces, and plenty of shade. The equipment was well maintained and there was ample parking while we were there, although I can imagine it gets busy in the summer. There is a slightly unusual one-way system as you enter the park so you might want to plan accordingly where you will want to be and where you will need to park.

Great local park for Salt Lake City. There are many events that are often his at this park. Bark at the park is one of my favorites. This is where you get to bring your dog to a big event and play with, literally, hundreds of did and dog living humans with vendors and live music. 

My wife loves running around the park which is about 1.4 miles per lap and I love to take the dog out and throw the ball around.  

Be careful in the later hours. There can be Time has been there is a homeless problem

Great place to ride your bike or jog around the park. Lots of people walking dogs and if you are into birds the Aviary is pretty cool. Sundays during the Summer this place is packed. Cool old cars on display. Hint: don’t try to find parking inside the park - park just East of the park ( no parking meters; it’s free)

name: Family History Library
address: 35 N West Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84150, USA
reviews: Such a wonderful experience! The helpful docents greet you and offer assistance as soon as you walk in the door and throughout your entire stay! I had 3 helpers, so many confirmations of the work I've already been doing and so many helpful tips and tricks to continue to help me with my ancestors! EVERYONE interested in genealogy should go!

Anytime I am in Salt Lake City, I make sure I visit this wonderful facility. The volunteers and staff are so helpful. It’s amazing the resources available to find your family ancestors. I am amazed by the entire operation. Thank you.

The Family History Library delivers and incredible experience for everyone, whether you are an advanced genealogist, or whether you just walked in off the street.  The discovery activities on the main floor are great for anyone age 5 and up. (My daughters want to come back here anytime we visit downtown)

You can learn so much about where you are from and who you are.  I would highly recommend a visit to the Family History Library to anyone who is passing through.

Incredible resource. Not everything one needs can be found searching online. There are many records that are only available through their system or via a book. Great place to do your genealogical  research. The staff is helpful too.
I had such a great experience here! I didn’t know what I was doing, but Glenda helped me out and was so kind and funny. I was able to learn a bit about my family!

name: Discovery Gateway Children's Museum
address: 444 W 100 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: This is one of the greatest children and family spots in the state of Utah. Absolutely phenomenal and interactive activities. Wish prices weren’t quite as steep as they are but it is a ton of fun to bring family and friends if they have never been. I make sure that this is at least a yearly stop off. When you are done here head over to any of the dining that is close! Great location for great times.

The place hadn’t changed much over the years. If your kids are over the age of 4-5 this place isn’t going to entertain them or at least for long. We brought our 6 y/o and she found about 30-45 minutes of fun. They charge $12.50 a person which seems a little pricey for the amount of time you actually spend inside the museum. The good thing about the price is the museum never stays that busy. Overall not a bad place for younger children, but once you’ve been here you’re probably not likely to return.

This place is pretty fun to bring your kid to! You would probably want to play with some of the exhibits there, too :) My daughter loved it when she went for the first time :D was a little hard to get her out, though. She didn't want to leave :P you can have your birthday here as well. It's super fun!

Fantastic place to bring young kids! We celebrated my two year old grandsons birthday there in a private room! Best party we've ever organized for toddlers!! Highly recommend this amazing place! It's truly a kids paradise!! The hardest part is simply getting then to leave when the place shuts down.

My son and I love this place. We’ve been to many birthday parties here. I decided to purchase the year membership and it was the best decision I made. Well worth the price especially during the winter. The facility is clean and well kept. The staff are all well professional and accommodating. My son loves every aspect of this place.

name: This Is The Place Heritage Park
address: 2601 Sunnyside Ave S, Salt Lake City, UT 84108, USA
reviews: They are under construction at the moment, building a beautiful new visitor center. The end of the building will have 40 foot wide window, that the big statue will be visible from. It will get gorgeous! It's a nest little state park that had been built up and renovated a lot during the last 14 years. Totally worth visiting. Beautiful mountain view up there and across the valley.

This is the place where Brigham Young allegedly exclaimed "This is the place".  I suppose after a long and treacherous hike across the mountains, they were all happy to see a nice empty valley.  Then they settled down, built a beautiful city, toyed with the idea of starting their own country and wisely choose against that and in the end created a successful and peaceful society.  Nice job!
Interesting place. I would like to come back in the summer when more buildings are open. The Pioneer Children Memorial was very nice. Would be nice if they had people around to answer questions

Google Maps says I went there three weeks ago but I actually went last spring. Every year they have an event where you can bring your kids to pet/feed the baby animals, ride the ponies and make crafts. It's fairly inexpensive and was really a lot of fun! The baby animals are so cute and your kids will LOVE it!

I love this is the place. They have a lot of old pioneer buildings all put in a row like they would in the old days. These homes are really well kept up for how old they are and they have guides to help you almost everywhere you go. 
They have information plaques everywhere and they give you a map to everything that you can and would ever want to see. 
This is a great way to learn about the history of Utah how it was settled and why. They also have old pioneer games that my kids loved playing. There is so much to do that it is hard to get it all done in one day. 
The best and worst days to go are the free ones. They have so much going on and a lot of extra activities but it is also packed and if you are pushing a stroller around the dirt Rhodes really make it hard.

name: Utah Museum of Contemporary Art
address: 20 S W Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: It was small.  Didn't really like the current exhibit.  Walk way to downstairs seamed unstable.  Nice atmosphere.
So amazing. There is a 5 dollar recommended fee. But you can pay it at the end.

This was a fun place to visit during an afternoon I spent downtown with my wife. There is no entry fee, but they encourage donations. I spent about an hour perusing the upper- and lower-level exhibits and saw a surprising array of art in a multitude of unique forms. 

They had videos, paintings, a live musician, and all kinds of abstract artwork. All of the art in the museum was strikingly evocative. If I have a single complaint, it's that I felt like the descriptions of the artwork and the inspiration behind each piece were all forceful attempts to shove the artists agenda or perspective down my throat instead of letting the art speak for itself.

All in all, a very fun place to visit.

Fantastic art installations, but unfortunately the staff are extremely rude and honestly homophobic. I would have loved to enjoy the beautiful art without being constantly pestered and “encouraged” to come back another time. Honestly a horrible experience and I will never return.

Was under construction for this visit. Optional donation for entrance. We paid $5 each, due to their Construction some of the displays were closed, but what we were able to see was interesting and informative. I always enjoy my trips here.

name: City Creek Park
address: Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews:
It is a very lovely park with the water of a stream running through it. 

 It's built on a Hill that is fairly steep and good exercise to hike up. The views in the park are of the city all around it.

 Salt Lake City is a very clean city and has wonderful architecture and the park is very close to the capital implying that it is very secure which it is. 

I remember they had a water phone but I don't remember any bathrooms.

A small park, mostly covered in trees with benches galore. A little man made pond and waterfall sit in the middle of it all, babbling away. A few gorgeous bridges to cross and snap pictures of! A good place to rest while walking around town.
Cool little park to walk around and spend some time while in the city.
Love taking my dog here to run around in the middle of the night. It's not too crowded and it's not fenced in. Great park.
Well maintained, friendly people, lots of various trails in the back to walk around. Plus it is dog friendly! I would have done 5 stars but there were too many dogs off their leashes.

name: Ensign Park
address: Ensign Peak Trail, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews: Very easy trail up to the peak. The current conditions with the snow melting makes the trail 100% thick mud. Wear shoes and pants you don’t mind getting wrecked or that you’d toss out after. Once April rolls around it will dry out. Just in time for the smog to clear up making the view that much better.
It was a fun little hike. Its not very steep. It’s about half a mile and it has a pretty view. It’s very historic. We went at about 9 in the morning and there wasn’t really anyone.
A beautiful place to hike. It’s not too long which is nice and the trail is very wide. The view of the city is gorgeous! A must do if you’re in salt lake
There are a gorgeous sunset and a view that you can watch. Although it is hard to go up and even harder to go down. Make sure you are wearing nonslippery shoes
Be careful parts of the trail are really muddy and the view is worth it!

name: Brigham Young Historic Park
address: North Temple & State Street, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews: Just love go here because it's so peaceful and always seem to feel the spirit no matter what time day or night it is I'm there
Attending one of the summer concert series performances.  Beautiful park manned by friendly welcoming people.

Nice little park next to the temple, and church office building. When Pokémon Go came out this park was crowded on summer nights because there are three stops tucked away in the back. It is also filled with some fun facts about pioneers and early Utah living. Like Brigham Young’s “large” family.......

Throughout the summer there are free concerts held here and they are always high quality shows. Plus on a nice Summer night it's just nice to be able to hang out outside. You can park in City Creek and the concerts are short enough that you can make it back before you're two hour limit, and free parking, expire!
Incredibly peaceful park. Great for relaxing and spending time with the family, with plenty of shade and room for sunshine. Very lovely statues, and a small stream that runs through it.

name: Tanner Park
address: 2660 Heritage Way, Salt Lake City, UT 84109, USA
reviews: Great little park to take your fur friend. All year long the dog pond and trail is open to hike. Moderately easy hike, the trail is nice and wide with plenty of room for your leashes dog and others to walk freely. Great in the summer and fall. On warm winter days it can also be great with minor snow fall.

A great place to take you dog for off leash walks. It's a fairly long trail with lots of places for your puppy to run around. Just have to be careful around other people's dogs since not all dogs are trained as well as they should be.

The beautiful views! Right at the mouth of Parley's Canyon, this park is a wonderful place to hike, walk, relax and play with your dog(s). There is even access to a shallow creek for dogs and people alike. So fun!

I really wish people were more responsible with CLEANING UP AFTER YOUR PETS!! 
This is a great park that's is being ruined by careless people... more than enough donated bags are provided. Just bagging it and leaving it on the trail does NOT count... -_- come on people...

Great dog park! Generally the park is open to everyone but it's primarily seen for the Dog park aspect. The trail system is decent and spans far enough that you can do the whole walk in about 30 minutes depending on how well your dog keeps up and how long you let them play vs walking. This is also the exit side for "Shoot the Tube",  but I've never seen a dog find it too distracting. I have seen multiple dogs need to be saved from the currents though, keep an eye on them in the water.

name: Pony Express National Historic Trail
address: 2423-2599 Sunnyside Ave S, Salt Lake City, UT 84108, USA
reviews: Interesting monument near This is the Place Heritage Park dedicated to the Pony Express. Well worth visiting for a good overview on the Pony Express, which came through this canyon.
Fun to visit and read about all the events the riders had to endure.

Was hoping for a really cool monument and it wasn't bad. If you are in the area stop by and see the monument. There are a couple of attractions in the area that you can see. Maybe in the summer there is more actions but in the winter nobody was there. So parking was easy and no admission fees.
A great walk through history. The information at the monument was instructive. The views from the monument are breathtaking! A beautiful place to visit.
Great history

name: Memory Grove
address: 288 N Canyon Rd, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews: My dogs love the trails and water. They actually look like there smiling when we are there.

Beautiful little place to go on a short hike or a longer hike if you go up City Creek, with dogs or friends. It sometimes gets busy and you can't find parking, so you may have to plan your adventure in advance.
Great park to walk your dogs. Just make sure you get to the off-leash part of the park before you take their leash off. It's a nice alternative to Tanner Park and has a stream running throughout.
I love this place. It’s so peaceful. Beautiful scenery
One of my favorite places..

name: Jordan Park
address: 1060 S 900 W, Salt Lake City, UT 84104, USA
reviews: They have a nice dog park here with trees. Glad that there is at least one decent dog park on the west side. It does need a slight improvement on one of the spring loaded gates on the north side. Majority of people that show up to this dog park are decent enough to clean up after their dogs.

Cool Chinese monuments/statues. Cool park to walk around and look at stuff, as well as play Pokemon go, there's lots of gyms and pokestops here. Good place to take pictures also. I recommend this park
Beautiful park! The peace gardens are amazing. It’s a free international museum. Highly recommended if you’re around any time of the year
This place is so nice. Diamond in the rough of this part of the city. Gardens, sculpture, play grounds, skate park, pavilions, dog park, baseball field, open grassy areas. Love it.

What a great park! It seems newer since the trees are pretty small and that means there's not much shade. But go on a cloudier day and you will have a great time.

There's a flipping zip line! It's a once in a lifetime experience, for sure.

Also, the covered seating areas are pretty nice and there's plenty of space to walk around and play.

name: Fort Douglas Military Museum
address: 32 Potter St, Salt Lake City, UT 84113, USA
reviews:
Great museum with lots of displays with a very knowledgeable staff.  Patrick was our guide and did a great job explaining the exhibits to our group.  

There was NO admission fee.
Staff hospitality was great! Educational...my 8 year old son loved it! I loved the tribute to nursing!

A very interesting look into military history of Utah, the staff were very helpful and friendly.  My son loved all the exhibits, thanks and helicopters.  That stop made his trip to Utah even more exciting. A must go if you are in the area.

If you love history this is the place for you. It has really cool stuff! Especially outside in the back. Big helicopters and tanks! Free admission. Donations are always welcome. Definitely worth your time. I would highly recommend.
Must see if you enjoy history of Civil War, WWI, WWII. Takes about 90 min to see everything,  the volunteers were friendly and knowledgeable. Entry is free, donations welcome. Good for all ages

name: City Creek Natural Area
address: 375 120 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews: One of my favorite places to explore. It’s very well maintained. I love how fast you can feel immersed in nature. I’ve done some fishing lower in the river. The hiking is great. Dog friendly up until the water treatment plant.

Absolutely wonderful area to walk, hike, explore, jog, bike ride, and take the dogs out for a walk. Lots of trails for all fitness levels. Guards at gate are friendly and helpful when available. Numerous trails available which are not on any maps. A variety of animals roaming at times if you happen to be lucky enough to spot them. Lots of picnic tables, restroom, and water fountain for use on paved road near the stream. Nice place to relax near the stream at the picnic tables at times. The tables are located about 3 every 1/2 mile on paved road. The road is 5 miles up to the rotary club park. There are 30 picnic tables up to the end at 5 miles which evens out to roughly 6 per mile and 3 per a half mile. There are some markers for the first 2.5 miles that mark each 0.5 miles up road from the guard post. During main season around June to October they alternate days between allowing cars and bicycles on the road. Even days are cars since most holidays are on even days. Odd days bicycles are allowed. Pedestrian are allowed any times. The area is open daily until 10pm. The restrooms close at 6pm during off-season and 10pm otherwise. During off-season both bicycles and pedestrian are allowed to use paved road and it remains closed to vehicles except for the main season. A few miles away for one week only in October there are deer hunting.  Water is turned off from around December? until May due to weather and freezing of pipes. A must visit in fall when the leaves change color and at sunrise or sunset and view the color of rising/setting sun across the valley to the South. 

The only thing to keep in mind is that after spending some time in the natural area or it's trails, a person might enjoy it enough that they fall in love with the area due to the wonderful aspects it provides.
Love this area, beautiful views and so many activities to choose from. Great biking or hiking trails and very pet friendly too!
Awesome place! Totally recommend for a nice walk, take the dog, bike it, or even grab a longboard if your feeling it. Great place that's close to the city, like 5 minutes from downtown close.

Very well laid out area. Fin to visit with family friends for events, going for walks on their beautifully laid out trail that's paved. Excellent views of The Valley from above and of olympus mountain.

name: Washington Square Park
address: 451 State St, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: Mayor's office and others related to Salt Lake City Corporation. Great place to stage protests like this one: Mom's Demand Action on gun control issues. Washington Square park hosts the Living Traditions festival and others. It's a beautiful building that was recently refurbished, the gargoyles , clock and the outside of the building. A huge project lasting several years and of course it was stabilized for earthquakes.
Very pretty. Was able to take some great pictures!
It's pride weekend! Food is amazing. Make sure to check out the food truck side and try a completo from Noemi's catering and cheese empanadas 😍

What an amazing 'City and County Hall'-building! Outside aswell as inside. I didn't know where to look first, let alone if you like taking pictures, this historic building definately has it all.
Amongst the citizens of SLC this beautiful piece of architecture is commonly known as "The Castle" where you have to go to to pay your parking fine... 😉
Beautiful architecture. Quiet and peaceful.

name: McCune Mansion
address: 200 Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews: Recently went to the McCune mansion for my wife’s company party and it was a great experience. The house is very well maintained and you can roam around with plenty of access. Rumors were that the house was haunted, I however was not able to experience the haunted aspect even after a few drinks haha. Good place.

The McCune Mansion is one of the impressive homes on Capitol Hill in Salt Lake City, Utah.

Built in 1900, Elizabeth and Alfred McCune had it built as a replica of a home they saw in New York City.

The 21 room mansion overlooks Temple Square and downtown Salt Lake majestically from a small hill and has materials from many parts of the world.
This place is breathtaking! We had a meeting in this mansion. The rooms have marble fireplaces. The painting hung threw out the home are unbelievable!
Such a beautiful, vintage venue. It worked so well with our couple's vision for their wedding day. The staff was so kind and helpful!
Exquisite mansion that we went to while in town for the doTERRA global convention.  It was catered and the grounds are beautiful with a wonderful view of salt lake city.

name: The Living Room Trailhead
address: 383 Colorow Rd, Salt Lake City, UT 84108, USA
reviews: This is a great walking trail.  It was a little more tricky than i expected, some of the trails are very narrow, with steep drops if you get it wrong.  I went in February, so trail had some "ice" on it.  i forgot to bring my ice cleats with me, I strongly recommend you bring them.  Beginning of trail is very muddy, and in some sections it is also very muddy in "gully" areas.  Most of trail great for walking on.  The views are spectacular, well worth the effort.  There are no facilities here , no rest room or water.  So bring your own water, some food, fruit, as it is a good work out climbing this.  On the trail today I saw people from all ages, as young as four years of age to what looked like over 55 years of age.  Great views, multiple trails to take.  No real signage, so suggest you have alltrails app or something similar.  There is plenty of parking spaces at trail head.

Nice trail. We went during winter so there was snow on the ground. It was quite muddy due to the snow so I'd recommend boots. Parking is along a road and I believe there is a nearby parking lot, but we just parked on the side. It was an easy trail. We took 2 toddlers and a dog so we only did half of it since the kids weren't up for the full trail. It had beautiful views of the mountain and the area though. I'd definitely go back again, but maybe ending of spring would be nicer for us.

Really nice intermediate trail with lots of options to increase the difficulty if you like. Great views of SLC. We opted for the less traveled paths and it took us right at 2 1/2 hours total (up and back). Worth the time.
Such an amazing hike I did it twice in one day. Breath taking views and a must for anyone who enjoys a moderate challenge. Close to downtown too.

For out of towners- Not "easy" but definitely possible. It starts in a nice little wooded area then you come up and out onto the main flat trail on the Bonneville shoreline. Continuing across you start a gradual climb weaving up and up and up. It gets narrow in a few places and they are single file. Then you start making a big turn to the left and more rocks and elevation. Along the way was beautiful wild flowers and on this left turn you can start to look out over slc. Continuing further the climbing trail feels very steep and but keep going! You turn again to the left and things get easier and smoother and the views increasingly get better! When you come to the top of that gentle rise you can get your view of all SLC and the Salt Lake. We came at sunset and it was worth it. There indeed is furniture in the form of rocks that have been compiled together for sitting places. If you are adventurous you can turn to your right and make your way up further on this summit. But you will have to actually climb and there are large slates of loose rock to watch out for. 

The trip back down after sunset was a breeze. And the cool air was great! And you get to see the night scape of the city on the way back down. I definitely recommend good shoes for loose rock on downgrades. It was a lively hike!

name: Millcreek Canyon
address: 3800 Millcreek Canyon Rd, Salt Lake City, UT 84124, USA
reviews: My family and I love this canyon. I’ve been coming here my whole life for Cub Scout camp and for campfires and picnics. We’ve tried to continue with our kids so they can experience the beauty of the canyon. There is a ton of shade near the picnic sites with the water running nearby. The canyon is well known for its many hiking trails. You pay when you leave the canyon, it’s $3 per car.

I’ve gone to Millcreek a lot. It’s really nice and has a lot of trails that are long or short and all are absolutely gorgeous. Some are just right off the road too, so there’s no need to travel far for them. Others lead to beautiful waterways, or fantastic lookouts. Some trails are paved, others are not. There are also a lot of free picnic areas you can sit and snack at before or after your hike. However, whatever trash you bring in you take out - they don’t have garbage cans up there. Definitely a place to take your family and furry friends.
They also give discounts to seniors and if you come on certain days dogs are allowed off leash.

Great place for picnic and easy hikes. The stream goes along with picnic area and hiking trail so you will always can feel fresh air, the sound of running water helps to heal your soul, really relaxing. They have nice picnic tables with fire rings so you can grill food and enjoy the wood with your family. I definitely recommend this place for families, kids and dogs to hike.

Such an absolutely beautiful canyon. Extremely close to the city, it's very clean, roads are excellent, so many trails to hike, bike and dog friendly, cute bridges everywhere, the restaurant is amazing. 

This canyon is perfect for so many activities! Picnics, biking, amazing trails, family reunions, ect

Such a beautiful canyon with many hiking trails, picnic sites, beautiful creek, ample parking and pit toilets. Go early during summer because it gets very hot as the day gets long. Take plenty of drinking water and hiking poles are quite helpful.
Hiking is easy to strenuous depending on the trail, dogs are allowed on leash on odd days, cyclists on even days.
There is a fee or an annual pass.

name: Rotary Play Park
address: Salt Lake City, UT 84105, USA
reviews: This was a fun place to stop for a picnic while visiting Salt Lake. There were plenty of trees, offering some shade, and lots of space for the kids to run around. There are also several play structures and swings. It looks like they have water features to play in, though these were turned off while were were there. My older boys liked the chess boards built into the tops of the cement tables and wished we would have brought a set to play with.
Fantastic park for adults and kids. Plenty of space to eat and play or watch you kids play!
Great play place for kids. Located in Liberty Park. It's the bigger play ground and there is tons to do.
Other than a little needed upkeep it'sa great place for kids to learn and explore.
My son had a lot of fun playing here. Sucks that the mallets to the instruments are often missing though.

name: Salt Lake City Council Hall
address: 300 State St, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews: Great place to see and just hang out. Everyone really knowledgeable and nice. Nice history
The great gift shop that used to be here is gone.  Ok place to visit, but could be great.

Loved the store. Lady there was extremely helpful. She also said we should get lunch at the cluck truck across the street.  We did and we were very impressed by the whole experience.  Hawaiian wraps were delicious!
It was closed when we stopped by, but a nice view from the place.
Nice place to start the visit.

name: Lindsey Gardens Park
address: 426 M St, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews: Lindsey Garden Park is the perfect place to take your child with an irrational fear of the undead. Just let your child play for a while on the lovely playground equipment and then point out The cemetery nearby full of dead people. Your child is sure to realize that the dead do not come back to life. They stay dead in their graves and playing at Lindsey Garden Park is fun.

I think this might be my favorite park in Utah,  when memories are concerned.   One of the best days of my life happened here!   I'm still mad for this Girl and I wouldn't have it any other way even though we're both in pretty crappy situations.   Mine is getting better day by day though.  So, when I am good she will have a place to find herself and her own good.   Lindsey Gardens will always get five stars from me because it is part of my Love story.
Big open area for dogs to run around. This is not a fenced park so make sure your dog comes on command. It's a nice area in the avenues with a good view of the valley.
Great park, there's a lot to explore and walk around
The park is incredibly nice lots of shade baseball diamond kids love the playground

name: Chase Home Museum
address: 1150 S Constitution Dr E, Salt Lake City, UT 84105, USA
reviews: Cute little Museum nicely placed in the middle of the park, Interesting stuff in the museum, quick walk throw is worth the time.
Perfectly sized for lunch break viewing. Great variety in the displays between the 3 galleries. Honestly it left me wishing it was twice as big
An interesting and free little museum and historical home.
Very little to see here that was historic.  Turned into a cultural museum about other countries.  Nothing about Mormon pioneers or the history of property or original family.

The exhibits were interesting, and the man at the desk was helpful. There's a whole reading room with activities for children that we all enjoyed. It was a good experience, but I'd like more explanation for the exhibits, like what the tools were used for or why they made these things.

name: Sunnyside Park
address: 1735 Sunnyside Ave S, Salt Lake City, UT 84108, USA
reviews: The city works really hard to keep this park clean.  They do an amazing job.  Baseball fields.  Tennis courts.  Walking paths.  A few homeless.. winter months no restrooms but they do provide a port a potty.  Dogs on leash please and bring a snack.  Covered pavilions with tables.  Enjoy your tax dollars at work.
The fields are kept in great condition. There's lots of space to run, and plenty of trees for a shady sit-down.

Large parking lot, a ball field, bathrooms, space to run swings and of course playground equipment! What more could you need. This park is also a location for child lunches from the school district for the 2018 summer. There are shaded areas and benches. Also a drinking fountain. Fun place to be located near the university of Utah.
We play on a coed flag football team here and I absolutely love it.  The bathroom is always clean and the overall park is taken care of.
Great for very early sunrise hikes.

name: Wheeler Historic Farm
address: 6351 S 900 E, Murray, UT 84121, USA
reviews: I love wheeler farm. The southern parking lot is great for when the farmers market is in season. Southern parking lot also has the playground and a large field for frisbee or football or anything like that.  The northern parking lot is smaller but I prefer it because you can walk straight up the paths to the animals. Further past the animals is a nice set of paths that are great for walking. We've seen snakes, squirrels, voles, foxes, red tailed hawks and during migration seasons there are a ton of unique birds flying through the farm. Great place to walk the dog. Love this place.

Been a long time since I have come here but worth every minute of time you spend. Beautful scenery, entrenched in the rich history of the area. I have visited here many times with family and friends. I love coming back to catch old memories and feel the joy of this wonderful area. Thank you for keeping it so nice!

This is a Utah gem! I’ve been coming here for years. Love seeing the animals. Love the activities and love being able to take my son and have him run around interact with animals and participate in the different activities. This is also a cool place to have birthday parties or just having picnics with friends or family.

This is a wonderful place to take the children. Go for family photos even if you take it yourself. They have different events through the different seasons. you can no longer bring your own bread as it's actually bad for the birds. You can bring proper duck food or buy some there when they are open during business hours. The farm is always open to go see. The kids still love the old clubhouse to climb into. The large park is in a great open area. They even have a smaller park for the little ones right next to the big one. A mom could sit on a bench and see both kids. They have a large open field as well if you want to bring a bat and ball. We've done a few birthday parties here.

This is a great place to visit with children, but I visit all the time by myself just to go for a walk. It is free to walk around the property and they have everything from farm animals, to vegetable gardens, flowers, a river, natural grass and forest areas, ducks, wood carvings, and a children’s play area. I really do like the farm!

name: Governor's Mansion
address: 603 E S Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84102, USA
reviews:
Beautiful, historical architectural building which is  great for shooting pictures. I only managed to do so from the outside last week but thoroughly enjoyed soaking in as much details as possible. 
From downtown SLC it's a beautiful stroll down this street where you'll find lots more of historical, interesting buildings and Mansions!
