CLOSED to the public. It is pretty from the outside but there is nothing you can review about it because it is CLOSED TO THE PUBLIC. 

The "US Bus Utah company" hop-on bus tour we took advertised this as a stop. It isn't even open to the public. It's very pretty from the outside but why would anyone want to get off the bus especially when the bus won't be back for 2 hours on the next run. 

DO NOT ADVERTISE THIS AS A TOURIST ATTRACTION  because you cannot even go inside it. This Google Places listing is misleading. And if you're a tourist visiting Salt Lake City, beware that US Bus Utah hop-on bus tours is very deceptive and dishonest.
Agree one of the most gorgeous historic buildings on South Temple.

I took a tour of the governors mansion June of 2018. Beautiful architect, beautiful home inside, I wish we could have seen more of the home such as the ballroom (top floor)and perhaps a design, sketch or floor plan of the 2nd floor- the private residence of the Governor, because the tour was too short. Also, we did not get a tour of the yard, and I felt rushed to leave otherwise I would have taken a picture of me outside because taking pictures inside the mansion is not allowed.
Second most impressive building of the East Side of the South Temple Street. Belonged once to an old billionaire of Utah, who himself had a very interesting life.

name: Cottonwood Park
address: 1580 W North Star Dr 300 North, Salt Lake City, UT 84116, USA
reviews: Awesome local park, not huge but party that runs parallel to a quasi River or Waterway. The grass is well-maintained.

The dog park here is amazing! I met some great people while letting my dogs play here! The park is a fun place for kids, teens, and adults! They have cute plastic hammocks that I love to lay on while letting my siblings play here! The homeless community seems scary from afar but they are actually very nice and great to talk to! I highly recommend coming to this park to walk your dogs, let them play, and let your kids play!

We loved this dog park. It is well kept. The locals help with that and someone brings gallon jugs of water for all the dogs and sets them on the tables. The people we met were all so nice and great dog parents. My do had so much fun. I highly recommend this dog park.

Cottonwood Park is small urban park in the Fairground community, near the Jordan Meadows community. During the summer the park is very busy. People come to enjoy family outings, play volleyball, basketball or even cricket. The small playground is often filled with children.

Walkers and runners use the paved paths in the park year round. The park's east boundary is the Jordan River. Across the river is Jordan River Parkway which is also heavily at times.

If the parks Dept would remove the homeless hut built just ten steps after the bridge that goes over the water on 5th N and Jordan parkway I would feel safer. It is too scary with all the debri to hide people in the very large hut.

name: Tunnel Springs Park
address: 1080 Eaglepointe Dr, North Salt Lake, UT 84054, USA
reviews: Beautiful park to take photos in. It has a big open field and you can see the sunset come down just beautifully.  I would suggest taking mosquito repellent. The mosquito's are bad up there. The amount of people that were there taking photos was unreal. But it sure was beautiful and our photos turned out great.

If you come here in the heat of the season you will find the hillsides dotted with the Wild Bride and her oft accompanying Groom. Observe them in their complex mating rituals. Some will be successful, some will not. 
If you look closely in the accompanying photo, you will see that I have captured an image showing this mating ritual. You too, may be successful. 
-David Attenborough

Love this park for photos! Doesn't require much walking/hiking for brides, and it's beautiful pretty much any time of year. There's also an area with some tall reeds that's really nice!

Photos by Natalie Michelle Photo Co.

Wonderful location.. Great spot for family pictures.  We were extremely fortunate that the inversion was not bad today. At 3:30pm, the temp was 26, but the photographs were beautiful.  Can't wait to see it in the summer.
Beautiful park, well kept, great for photography.

name: Mueller Park Picnic Area
address: Mueller Park Rd, Bountiful, UT 84010, USA
reviews: This has to be one of my top 10 favorite places to hike. Amazing anytime of year! There is a good combination of shade and sunshine. Pretty rocky the further up you go. Also watch out for bikers!

I love going biking at Mueller Park. It's a challenging trail going uphill, but totally worth it. Usually gets crowded during sunny days, people on bikes, people hiking with dogs or people running. Watch out on corners! Beautiful from Big Rock to look down at the Great Salt Lake and surroundings. I would choose the sunset time to go up there. Grab some water with you!
I love that park. It's perfect for the little ones and to take pictures during any season. Perfect spot for family hangouts with firepits on location and facilities for picnics... It's perfect!
Such a beautiful place to go! Walk around, enjoy the nature, have a campfire and enjoy life.

Easy 7.3 mile out and back trail.  Wide and well maintained.  Popular with mountain bikes who aren't courteous and expect the hikers to always get out of their way.  Overall a nice hike except for the pushy mountain bikes.  Maybe everyone could start following the "party going up hill has the right of way" rule.

name: Murray Park
address: 296 E Murray Park Ave, Murray, UT 84107, USA
reviews: This park is fantastic! It's big and secluded enough that you sometimes wouldn't believe that it was in the middle of a city. There is a path that goes directly up the middle of the park that is a lovely walk. There is such a variety of things here too there are multiple play places and even those adult exercise equipment things! This would be a great place for a family activity or a date or really anything! I also love the anti Audra gun bear the West entrance.

I absolutely love love love this park!! I’ve been coming to this park for years. It’s a massive park and there is so much you can do. There is a kid play area that has awesome musical features. There is an outdoor work out area. There is a community center and indoor pool with an outdoor pool. There is a pickle ball court. There are large fields for soccer and there are a couple of baseball fields. There is an amphitheater, picnic areas, and a stream that flows through the park. There is a farmers market and food truck type events that happen often. My son and I will continue to visit. It is a jewel of Murray City.

So much fun for all ages. From the swing sets, to the multitude of slides and fun spinning devices on the playground. It's great for even my 18 month old, she really enjoyed the music features that were built in next to the playground. There are loads of walking areas and the park was very well maintained.

My family and I love this park. There are so many fun walking trails. There are a few different playgrounds to enjoy as well.
We have seen soccer games/practices going on here. Baseball games as well. It is very family oriented, and is usually popular with people as the weather warms up.

Great park, awesome kids pool.  Indoor pool has a really nice baby play area and a big slide for older kids that parents can take the toddlers down as well.  Great way to kill a few hours as a family for less than $20.

name: Cytybyrd Cafe
address: 450 S 200 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: Really cool place.  The food was awesome. We did the stir fry bar they had and Ruben sandwich with Cajun waffle fries.  The price was very reasonable.  The waitress and the chef were very polite and friendly.  Only complaints are that they didn’t do very good at filling my water and the baby chair we used had no table on it( it looked to me missing).  Even with those, it definitely deserves 5 stars. We for sure will be coming back. Loved it.

It's a cute little cafe inside the city building. The food was good, and our waitress was polite, but they took a little while longer to get our food than we expected. Perhaps we were in too much of a hurry.
What a wonderful spot tucked in the split basement of Washington Square.  They pay attention to detail and taste. Bravo.

The cafe is inside the City Hall, underground.  The interior of this cafe is more upscale restaurant than a cafe, with arts, high multiple arc ceiling and classy bar counter.  The server is friendly and attentive.  The steak was a bit over done, meat already cut when served, savoury, taste evenly spread.  Yet it was $14.  The place was not crowded.  Highly recommended.

Totally disappointing. At the time I'm writing this review this place has 4+s with over 200. reviews I stopped by at lunch time and ordered their grapefruit and beet salad with chicken and my friend got a breakfast sandwich with fried eggs, sausage and cheese on toast. It took them around half an hour to get us our order, by the time we got our food we had finished way ago our glasses of prosecco. There were only four pieces of chicken in my salad and the bread that came with it was cold as they just got it out of the fridge. The salad did taste good though. My friend's sandwich was rock solid, but also tasted good. Definitely not a 4+ stars place.

name: Gardner Village
address: 1100 W 7800 S, West Jordan, UT 84088, USA
reviews: Gardner Village is such a great place to go wander and eat. It's so relaxing and we especially love going during Halloween to see the witch displays. I also love taking my kids at Christmas to see all the elves. The shops are fun, but they change too often. We miss the doll shop and Christmas store!  I would definitely recommend spending an afternoon at Gardner Village.

The shops are cute little shops with things ranging from kids toys to books to antiques to clothing to costume pieces to food, e.t.c. There's even a petting zoo across the street. The themed times (like around Halloween, for example) can be fun, but very crowded. Most stores are NOT stroller friendly, though there's often "stroller parking" just outside. If you like fighting crowds go whenever. If you don't, try in the morning on a day there's school.

American Rust Company is the place to stop at! Such amazing antiques and all decently priced! Not to mention the manager of the store Dawn is so knowledgeable and is willing to help answer questions! Definitely  definitely do not pass up this shop!

Glover Nursery had their company Christmas party at The Gathering Place in Gardner Village. It was so lovely and cozy. Their chicken was creamy and delicious. I didn't get to eat the vegetarian pasta dish, but it looked amazing too! All around gorgeous and alluring atmosphere. 😉👌🏼
We always make a point to go there each holiday because they do such a spectacular job decorating.  It’s also fun to meet with friends and walk around then end with a yummy lunch at Archibald’s. ❤️

name: Church Fork Picnic Area
address: 5802 Millcreek Canyon Rd, Salt Lake City, UT 84109, USA
reviews: Beautiful scenery for a picnic and family parties. Multiple waterfalls and a river.

Clean campground with a lot of spots. It was a busy day, but people were nice. I wasn't excited about the park fee on the way out, but then the person in front of us paid it for us! 
There was a reserveable group spot, and lots of private picnic areas that all had firepits. The area is on a river that Cascades though the picnic areas, and it has a nice ambiance to it.

This place is beautiful. It’s great for picnics with small and large groups, and everybody has their own secluded “space” to picnic. 

Each picnic spot I saw seemed to have a few picnic tables and a fire pit. 

You do pay $3 per vehicle on the way out and they don’t accept the national park pass. But for a pleasant picnic spot, it’s worth the small fee. 

The scenery is gorgeous. It’s great for an outing in the mountains.

Some of the most picturesque picnic sites you've ever seen, nestled in a steep side canyon within Millcreek Cayon. A stream rollicks through the sites, creating a beautiful atmosphere. These sites can be busy on weekends, and parking can be a problem. This serves as the trailhead to Grandeur Peak as well, which contributes to the crowding of the area.
There is plenty of shade. The creek is beautiful. And it is clean. Overall an amazing place would totally recommend.

name: Salt Lake City Cemetery
address: 200 N St E, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews: It’s an incredibly historic and beautiful cemetery. It’s a fun place to do a scavenger hunt for the gravestone of the prophets of the LDS church. You have an incredible view of the valley at several spots through the cemetery. It’s just a beautiful and peaceful place to take a stroll on a relaxing afternoon.

A beautifully situated cemetery with great views of the Wasatch Mountains, Salt Lake City, and the University of Utah. This serves as the final resting place for many leaders of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, including most of the presidents of the church, as well as many church apostles. A lot of history preserved in the cemetery.

My Dad is buried in the upper Veterans section. Nobody cares for the Veterans section. Many of the older grave markers in the ground for distant war casualties are long forgotten, overgrown at the edges. I go twice a year to clean up my Dads headstone and pay my respects. Usually on Memorial Day Sunday when is quiet nobody having their picnics in the other sections. Clean up the bird poop on the Bird Colonel's gravestone. He isn't actually buried there in a casket. Just some ashes in a vial.
I love to just visit here you never know who you'll get to see.

A peaceful and interesting place to walk around or jog around.

Want a safe place to walk head to your local cemetery.

name: Salt Lake 2002 Olympic Cauldron Park
address: 451 1400 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84112, USA
reviews: I had the opportunity to go to some of the Olympic events in person. It was such a great experience.  I would reccomend  here to anyone who would like to learn more about the Olympics
Not what I had expected. It was not open to public and there isn't a clear view of the cauldron from the entrance to the football field.
Not much to see, acctually. Its better to go TO Olympic park, you will see more there.

Only has cauldron, nothing else. 
All museum/visitor center materials moved to park city Olympic Park.
Not much to see beyond the university's stadium. There was only 1 banner we saw that was related to the Olympics. I always dreamed of seeing the SLC arena or a more welcoming area.

name: Herman Franks Park
address: 1371 700 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84105, USA
reviews: We love this dog park it keeps getting better all the time they just added some new benches a new dog agility course. The only thing is I have an older dog who doesn't like the tiny gravel rocks and there's not really much grassy area but my young 2 Aussie boys love running in that Park
This place is awesome! Has a lot of room for plenty of dogs. It has a grass side and a gravel side. Lately they've been building more and I can't wait to see what they do.
Always a great place off leash park for dogs
Lot's of dog come to visit there.  A mean dog is there every once in a while but owners are usually pretty good about keeping and eye on things.  It's a fun little getaway for our pup.

We come here often to let our babies socialize and play. Have yet to have any kind of negative experience here. The dog and the people have always been friendly and it looks like they are in the process of adding things so I'm excited to see how it turns out

name: First Encampment Park
address: Salt Lake City, UT 84115, USA
reviews:
I love all the rocks and the landscaping is awesome. It would be even more awesome is they added waterfalls to the landscaping to go with all the rocks. Cool and chill place. Loves you all.
Asalaam peace

Nice little park in a nice little area. It has a few benches and places to lay on the grass. Plenary of shade as well. They have a few flower patches that get a lot of insect life which is fun to catch and snap some photos of. They do seem to have a lot of homeless people hanging around but they try and hid so they stay out of the way. Defiantly a cool spot to check out if you are on a walk but nothing to make a special trip for.
Quiet, quaint with nice rock piles to entertain almost anyone who loves random rock gardens.
It's all about the water baby. Up and down between 200 e a nd 300 e there were the only fresh water springs in the valley.
Like it enough to volunteer again this year. Happy 24th.

name: Neffs Canyon
address: 4326 White Way, Salt Lake City, UT 84124, USA
reviews: I can't say enough about the beauty of this hike. Sledding here is a thrill and adventure. My pups can run off leash and I'm pretty sure if they could ask me to take them anywhere it would be here. It's a winter wonderland in winter and I will update my review when summer arrives. Please don't bring your kids here if they are afraid of dogs because this is a very populated canine trail!
I wouldn't say this place is okay. I'd give it 3.8 out of 5. The snow really adds another level of beauty to this short but great trail.

At least in winter and beginning of spring it it is either fluffy Cold Snow(Great for sledding or it's Icy and slippery, and painful if you fall. During that time it's a good idea to wear all snow gear and "grips" on the bottom of your snow boots.  You'll be less likely to slip.
I wouldn't recommend the winter version for beginner hikers. I've never been after snowmelt, I'm guessing that's much easier,  but not Easy.

One of my favorite places to get to quickly and find a little nature therapy. Dogs are allowed and many people have them off leash. 
So many different trails up this canyon. It really becomes a “choose your own adventure” kind of trail and that’s what I love about it.

Very beautiful stream and has somewhere to sit down and chill at the very top. The weather was nice today. Cool breeze with just enough sun to keep you cozy :) it's a bit steep at first, but there will be a little bank up the stream. From there it's cruising. I believe the trail is a little over a mile which is nice if you want a short hike.

name: zest kitchen & bar
address: 275 S 200 W, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: I love Zest! It's hands down the best vegan establishment in the state. Delicious, locally sourced ingredients & an amazing hardworking crew - you can't go wrong. Try the Chocolate Beet Torte, it's guaranteed to blow your mind.

I was traveling on business and, as a vegetarian, it can be difficult to find restaurants with good options.  I'm so glad to have discovered Zest!  The atmosphere is laid back, service was great and the food was amazing.  Everything is fresh and not processed.  They have a great drink menu, but also got a tea to go and I would highly recommend!  Love this place and will be back.

I visited Zest with a group of friends one afternoon a couple of weeks ago. We split the bill two ways, and have had a number of troubles with it. Drinks somehow ended up all on one tab, so I simply repaid that person with cash, while he charged his card. That means my bill should have been for $52 worth of food (2x$16 entrees + $9 chips, + a $9 cheesecake) plus tax and tip.

When I got my credit card statement the charge was $99 even. My friend's card was also charged for a completely different amount than the receipt he signed. I think they tried to fix the drink mixup, but the numbers don't add up, and altering a receipt after you've signed and left is shady. All told, my girlfriend and I are into one small meal for $125. Not worth it. We had to open a credit card dispute.

For what it's worth, the food was okay, but not great. There are much better vegan options in town. The cocktails were really very good, but I wouldn't visit just for drinks.

We’ve been coming here since the day before they got open. Hands down THE BEST vegan restaurant I have ever been to in the world. 
Fresh, unique, delicious, complex, flavorful, creative and kind food in stylish, cozy environment. 
Every bite is filled with flavor and so much joy. 
My partner who is the biggest carnivore and can’t imagine eating his food without animal protein, LOVES coming here with me and always leaves fully satisfied and 100% satiated.
The desserts are otherworldly. 
YOU HAVE TO COME HERE, YOU WILL REGRET IT IF YOU DONT!!! Get the nachos. Just get the nachos.

Zest!!! What an all around amazing experience. Great tasty food that is all plant based. Everything from the drinks, appetizers, main dish, and dessert looked and tasted delicious. The ambience is perfectly set with dimmed lighting and unique light fixtures. Table seating is kind of close but it worked. The service was on point. Patrick made excellent recommendations. Taylor, the manager, was super accommodating. I will be back.

name: Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana
address: 260 S 200 W, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: Gluten free people this is your place! My sister has to order gluten free because of an allergy. It's $4 extra for gluten free crust which is a bummer, but in this case it was worth it! Fluffy, delicious crust instead of flat cracker crust. So great for gluten free people who crave good old fashioned crust! We tried the Margherita which was delicious! They have authentic Italian pizza, my favorite!

I was really optimistic about this place since they had a wood fire oven, turns out I got excited over nothing. Crust was heavier than usual and the toppings weren't really all that fresh. The olives tasted like mayonnaise...

This was one of the best brick oven pizzas places I have eaten at, in a long time. It wasn't overcooked at all. The best pizza hands down would be the margarita pizza. Service was a bit slow when it got later in the night, but it was quite busy. This would be an amazing lunch! Thank you all for the awesome night.
The Pizza was amazing and it was ready really fast. The meatball was tasty and the salad we got was really good too. After dinner we had Gelato in the next room.

This is good pizza. Chatted with the pizza makers and they were able to answer any questions I had as well as super friendly. 

I've never has neopolatin pizza before this but I'm a fan. A little pricey for personalized pizza but I'd go again in a heart beat.

name: Takashi
address: 18 W Market St, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: First time here and it was amazing. Be prepared to wait to get in. We were on wait list for about 50 minutes for a table of two. Waitress was super friendly and knew the products. She was able to explain most of the rolls with no issue. Once seated she was quick to get us started. Food came out fairly quickly. They were good about bringing out the rolls as they were ready. Some places try to make a grand entrance with everything at once. Not here. Amazing dishes. Everything was super fresh. People kept our drinks filled as well, not just our waitress. Team effort.

Sensational sushi selection! You can taste the freshness of all the ingredients. However... Coming here after 6pm should be considered an all night venue. Weekend wait times usually reach 3 hours. Nonetheless, the meals are worth the wait. 

Also, they have a small bar/restaurant with a shared entrance right beside them. I don't remember the name but they have some good cocktails and an eclectic menu that can cater to many.

Anyhow... If you haven't been to Takashi, then you need to go at least once. The ambience is superb and they have a wall of Fame in the front. They are plates that are meant as plaques for each year that they will an award for best food (or something along those lines).

Yeah... They're doing something right. 😏

Undoubtedly one of the best sushi restaurants in the country. Comprehensive selection of Japanese beers I’ve never seen elsewhere in the US. No reservations so you can expect a wait, but it’s worth it. I suggest sitting at the bar rather than a table. At the bar you can converse with the sushi chefs and probably do better than ordering off the menu.

Yesterday was our first time we came to that restaurant. But It is definitely not the last time. We enjoyed the evening very much with the attentive service, with the fine  cuisine and wine and with the friendly price. We will definitely go back there soon.

This is one of the best sushi places I have gone to. The rolls are what they do best - if you sit at the bar, the sushi chef can help you navigate the menu. He helped me pick a roll with salmon, avocado, and lemon. I also got the small sashimi plate, and was less impressed, so I would stick with the rolls if I returned. Everything is presented beautifully, though!

name: Red Iguana
address: 736 W North Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84116, USA
reviews: The sign on the building says it all! “The Killer Mexican Food” has never been a truer statement! The food is amazing! The staff is friendly! The restaurant is cozy and and comfortable, it’s not too packed and it’s not too spacious! Everything on the menu is absolutely spectacular and you can’t go wrong with anything! Authentic Mexican food that won’t disappoint!

Wow!  The wait was SUPER LONG for dinner even though it was a Saturday night.  It was cold outside but the restaurant is small and has no room for folks to wait inside, which is super crummy.  But they had heaters outside and provided hot cider to sip on for free so that was a nice touch.  Once inside we had a great time!  Service was great, food was great, drinks were great!  We had lots of questions about the many mole sauces so they brought out a dish with each sauce on it so we could try them before we ordered. Very good experience overall!  And judging by the line this is a local favorite.

Amazing!! Well worth the wait.  The food was outstanding.  I’m from California so finding Mexican food on par is not always an easy task.  This place does it right.  Service was also great! Try the fried ice cream for dessert.

Been here in 2017, and we still talk about this restaurant every month.
Everything was just fantastic. There was a line to get in, but it was really worth the wait.
The best beef fajitas we had in a very long time. Great atmosphere, would really recommend going for diner here!

Does anyone else really need to tell the world how amazing this place is?! Google asked me to... so here goes: Red Iguana is the first place tell people from out of town to visit for the best food in the valley. It cannot be missed... except for once you are too far away to get there again anytime soon.

name: Just Burgers
address: 135 E 100 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews:
Dubai lands in Salt Lake.  Just wow!

Just Burgers found out the pefect burger cooks in the same amount of time that Queen's "Bohemian Rhapsody" plays.

The first flip: "Mama, i dont want to die"
Add cheese: "so you think you cam stop me"

Then the burger finishes at 155 degrees as the song fades away.

I ordered a cheeseburger meal. It was cooked quickly. It definitely hit the spot on a Sunday afternoon. The patty was tasty and the bun was toasted golden brown. The fries were the perfect texture. They had a ton of toppings from pineapple and roasted garlic to hoards of fry sauce. I’ll be back for sure.
Keep it simple. That's what these guys do and their burgers are fantastic. Everything is fresh and tastes amazing.
I don't usually eat burgers, but someone is going to have to restrain me. Easily better than some of the fancy restaurant burgers I've had.

Burger is amazing. This is like a food truck burger and fries. It is cooked with love, and care. The fries are natural cut fries which are always the best. You also get to load up your own toppings which makes it that much more enjoyable because you can handcraft it each time. 

I highly recommend this place.

name: HSL
address: 418 E 200 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: WOW. One of the best meals I’ve ever had from start to finish. Every dish we ordered was beautifully crafted in flavor palette as well as presentation. I was truly struck by the dynamic flavor pairings, the freshness of ingredients and level of service. This was truly an elevated fine dining experience. My favorite was the apple toast- absolutely superb.

Loved our experience at HSL!
Definitely recommend making a reservation ahead of time. There is a small, SMALL parking lot behind the restaurant, but chances are it will be full so plan on parking on the street. The ambience to this place is lovely, with dim lighting and beautiful decor. I especially loved their cute seating arrangement ideas, with some couches/fancier chairs scattered in different places. The table was set beautifully and the waiter explained the menu very well. This was our first time here so we didn't know much about ordering, so wait for your waiter to explain things if you haven't been here before. We ordered the Peppers as an appetizer- came in a hot bowl with spiced hummus and they were good. For the main meal, we ordered the HSL burger, medium rare, and the fried chicken. The fried chicken was DELICIOUS! It wasn't heavy AT ALL and was somehow pretty light, considering it was fried chicken. The burger was AMAZING! I hate medium rare anything because I can't stand the blood, but there wasn't a trace of any liquid on this burger and it was absolutely perfect! It is also the cheapest thing on the menu, so that was a plus. 

Overall, really neat experience. Definitely try it!

Amazing food and service! I’ve literally never tasted anything like it...simply delicious! My mom suggested it for dinner. We started out with the sourdough toast. I had the fried chicken, and she had the sea bass special. I can’t remember the name of the dessert, but it had chips, caramel and pecans.....another perfectly balanced dish. I’ll definitely be going back!

We love HSL! It's our "go-to" for anniversaries, birthdays, and other special occasions. The menu changes quite a bit, but everything we have tried has been great! The dishes have so much thought put into them and it shows. 

Some of my favorites that I included pictures of are the seeded cracker, the pork shank, and the whiskey caramel pudding.

Ordered from the starter and hot/cold menu, interesting and lively flavor combinations. The cauliflower, and the meat and cheese dishes are divine.  Reservations recommended for this busy hot spot. Staff was attentive without hovering. Their in-house tonic is tremendously yummy. Street parking available.

name: Valter's Osteria
address: 173 Broadway, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: Valter's is so much more than just an excellent restaurant. It's somewhere you can experience a poetic food odyssey. Every dish is a painting of vibrant colors and interesting flavors that each pay homage to Valter's rich family legacy. It's like celebrating love, history and tradition on a plate. I can't wait to go back.

Highly recommend coming here. The food is amazing and the service is even better. If you're lucky you will get Eduardo as your server and Lee as your bartender. You cant go wrong with anything on the menu. There is Valet for $8 or street parking for $2.50 an hour. You should try and get a reservation but if not there is a small bar with 4 seats at it so it may be full.

Went here for my anniversary dinner and I'll just say I wasn't impressed.  The restaurant was small and over packed.  For someplace you have to make reservations for I didn't think I'd be crammed into a tiny space.  My wife paid 80+ dollars for the steak and potatoes. She did not eat it we took it home with us. I had the seafood scampi dish or as I like to call it the tomatoe water with a couple noodles. Only like one or two of the mussels had meat in them. I've had better experiences at a busy Olive Garden. As a foodie I'm always up to try new things... this I did not enjoy.

Excellent food! One of a handful of favorite fine dining restaurants in Utah. One of the best Italian restaurants I've ever dined at. Meat and fish is always cooked perfectly and usually seasoned well. Noisy and somewhat cold decor but fun atmosphere. Excellent service ☺

This place has the best street tacos I've ever had. The pastor and chicken are incredibly flavorful and seem to just melt in your mouth. They have some of the best homemade chips n salsa I've tasted. These guys know what they're doing. Order at the counter and take to your table so it's a chill atmosphere when you just want some bomb food and got stuff to do.

name: Caffé Molise
address: 404 S W Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: Amazing vegetarian options! Wonderful ambiance! The only issue I had was being placed in a seat directly across from the door and the air coming inside was freezing. Otherwise we had a lovely evening.

Everything was good here.  My only complaint would be my lamb was over cooked.  When I asked I was told that I could not pick my temperature.  I prefer my meat rare and it came out at a medium well.  Beyond that, the flavors of everything were great and I'll definitely come back

My husband and I went here for his birthday dinner a few months ago, it was so fun to try a new place.  You did not disappoint!  Such good food!  Nice inviting atmosphere and our waiter was so professional and friendly.  Thank you!

Great atmosphere, was a little noisy. The service was great but slow.  I had a dish that I never had before and it turned out not to my personal liking. Our server was amazing and brought me something else that was great. It not that the dish was bad, I ventured out and tried something different. It just wasn't me. The family loved everything and ate most everything on their plates.  The flavors were more on a mild side so don't expect that pop of flavor.  It was good though.  The presentation was too notch.

This is a beautiful venue. The waiter was attentive and patient while we waited for all in our party to arrive. The salmon, ribeye and gnocchi were all liked by the people in my party. The Mediterranean salad was excellent with peppers. I had the lasagna. It was a large portion but overall too much tomato. The bathroom had very plush paper towels in contrast to the 1(!) ply toilet paper.

name: The Bayou
address: 645 State St, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: Great food and great beer selection! It's no joke when they advertise their beer selection. The list looks almost like a book, sorted by every different type of beer you could ever want. To go along with the beer selection, I haven't found a food dish that I didn't enjoy. On Friday I had their pizza special which was a chicken cordon blue pizza, and it was phenomenal! Last thing, The Bayou is a great place to try out Epic Brewery's selection. The mark up on Epic's beers is very small, equal to that of the liquor store pricing. I would definitely recommend The Bayou if you want to try out Epic's amazing selection of local beers.

There are a few issues I had the lunch at the Bayou. 

First was slow service. We got there shortly before noon, were seated, and our drink orders were taken but then we waited for about 10 min waiting for drinks. I noticed others being served their drinks that arrived after us. Honestly, I think we were forgotten. 

Second was food. The fries were good and the fry sauce was an interesting twist with the Cajun seasoning. The turkey burger I ordered was not that great. It hardly had any flavor and was SO dry. The menu urged the customer to resist adding sauces but it was like eating sand. Honestly, if I hadn’t been as hungry as I was, I probably wouldn’t have eaten it. So, food-wise, it left much to be desired.

We had some of the best service that I've had at any restaurant in quite some time there. The food was excellent and served quickly. One downside to it was the gumbo was too smokey in flavor for us. Other than that, the Cajun fettuccine is awesome as was the blackened salmon. We really enjoyed the  Cajun Seafood ball appetizers  too. Really hard to fault the selection of beers, either; incredible variety on hand!

Stopped in after a long drive from California on Fat Tuesday and was greeted with cold beer, amazing food and a New Orleans style brass band blasting into the night. Such a great experience and felt like that was exactly where I needed to be that night. Thanks y'all.
This is a great locals restaurant with a southern vibe. If you are in town, check out this  local place. Get here early because it will fill up fast.

name: Tacos Brazil
address: 160 E 300 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: I simply enjoy their food. I always get awesome customer service there. The place is well organised and the cashiers are always very welcoming. Will come back again.
Best Tacos in the city
I simply liked their food. I always get awesome customer service here. The place is always clean and the staff members are always friendly. Highly recommended.
One of my favorite spots to grab something to eat. great location, well organised, and awesome service. Keep it up!
I love this place.  The burritos are on point and the prices can't be beat.

name: Stoneground Italian Kitchen
address: 249 E 400 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: This place is conveniently located near the light rail stop and the ambience was really nice, especially with the fireplace. I had a pizza and it was the perfect size for me and the ingredients tasted pretty fresh. Service was good and I had an overall pleasant experience.
Really good Italian food. Lots of vegetarian options. Staff was great and the ambiance was just really nice. We really enjoyed our time there.
Black Tagliatelle, is a must. Very delicious. Staff is also great. Will be back.

I visited with 3 co-workers, and all 4 of us really enjoyed our meals. The side salad that I added to my lunch exceeded my expectations. For $2 I expected greens and a little dressing, but received mango and plenty of flavor. 

We shared an order of focaccia after asking for a recommendation and we're all impressed. 

The baked Ziti was also good. A cheese lover would particularly enjoy it. 

Recommended.

This is our go to date night.  The food is always delicious.  Well we only order three things but we can confirm the lasagna, margarita pizza and doughnuts  are delicious. Parking is easy and there servers are attentive.  The atmosphere is also pretty nice with the view of the library and mountains.

name: Eva
address: 317 S Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: (Um,..)  Yumm!   Looks cool inside, I liked the lighting!  Also the lamb was mmmm!  And the vegan pizza was good qith the pumpkin sauce(?).

We held a small dinner meeting here and were surprised by 1) how good everything tasted, and 2) how much more talkative we were because of the "family style" dining. Reaching across the table, picking at each other's plates, and asking one another about our food got us talking and sharing stories so quickly and easily, we didn't even notice the time pass. I can't wait to come back with my family! Thanks to the Eva team for a lovely dinner, and for many to come.
Place was awesome. Interior was beautiful. Staff were courteous. Seating section was comfortable and clean. Great eating experience.

Great downtown location! Cool vibe. We didn't have a reservation on a Saturday evening but we got there pretty early and they got us in. We sat in the back room which was like a long hallway, rustic but definitely inviting. Loved the place. The food was delicious. Small plates shared. We ordered a pretty big selection of small plates, all of which were really good. I ordered the drink, Foret and it was seriously one of the best cocktails I've ever had. This place has a great vibe with excellent food and great staff. Will definitely return.

Cutest place, definitely a good place for a special night! We spent Valentine’s day there and it was a very good choice! They have daily/weekly alcohol and food specials that are from local places and the ambiance is 10/10. I’ve recommended it to so many people!

name: Bambara
address: 202 S Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: Love this restaurant! Even their room service at Monaco is amazing! From the decor, to the cocktails to the entrees, you’ll enjoy every minute of it. The atmosphere is comfortable yet fashionable. If you haven’t had a Sunday brunch here with all your friends then you’re definitely missing out. Mimosas and Eggs Bennie! And save room for dessert... you won’t be sorry! 100% compliments to the chef! Great for a date night, great for groups, and great for any other occasion.

Not a fan of the location. It is inside of a hotel.There was a weird smell coming from the vents. The filet is to die for! And melts in your mouth. Even though the presentation of the cheese board was beautiful it came out on what looked like a white lazy Susan and was disappointed it was not presented on a beautiful shaped block of wood, which is half the fun of ordering a cheese board. The mustard was delicious! But the cheeses were extremely disappointing and bland. I like really funky cheeses, that slap you in the mouth, and these were for beginner cheese tasters that are not that adventurous. My friend loved them because they were not scary to try. The quail was tiny but very good.

Bambara and the associated bar, The Vault, are both located in the Hotel Monaco.  Often hotel bars and restaurants are mediocre but that is not the case with these two spots.

The atmosphere in The Vault on Pride weekend was convivial and service was very good.  I ordered a wedge salad with chicken which was delicious.  The cocktails, while pricey ($16) are thoughtfully created and original.

It's a great spot for a quick bite and a delicious cocktail.

This night was planned for my wife and I for our 3 year anniversary. I called a little late to get reservations on Monday this week, and today is (Saturday). I called and talked to someone, didn't write down the name or recall what her name was (horrible with names). The conversation went with explaining that I needed a reservation but it was booked. I then asked how long the wait would be for walk-in, and was told it just varies. So I explained we would just show up right before opening and wait for a table. Well we travel up, show up 15 minutes early to opening and ask that we get on the wait list. Well they then tell me that the tables are completely booked. I asked why I was told on the phone that we could walk-in and there was no explanation. We are now sitting in the bar, and as I sit here writing this, I'm very angry. This ruined our night and I should have just left and took my business elsewhere, but I have a large gift card for us to use. So I guess I will leave a 1 star review and sit in the bar that smells like alcohol and cigarettes while we try and have a nice evening.... Thanks Bambara

My wife and I had our Valentine's dinner (a few days later on Monday to avoid crowds) and loved every bit of it. We both ordered the filet of beef and both agreed it was one of the top two or so steaks we've ever had in our lifetime. The service was great and attentive. The drinks we're perfect as well as the tempura veggies appetizer. Couldn't recommend Bambara more! Can't wait to eat there again.

name: Current Fish and Oyster
address: 279 E 300 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: Fabulous place! Food is phenomenal, staff is amazing, and the atmosphere is perfectly charming. I've been a few times, and everything has just been wonderful. The Grilled Oysters have RUINED me from any other preparation! Go and eat here, you won't regret it

Freshest seafood and best atmosphere! That patio is everything! If there's ever a measure of great taste, it's that the stew distracted me from fries... and the fries were amazing!  Oysters + Grilled Oysters + Clam Dip + Seafood Stew and fries = "Hell uva" good choice! No one does it quite like Current -- that's a fact!

The pricing is high but the food is so, so worth it.The oysters here are so damn good and the entrees were perfect. The lighting and the decor feels intimate even in such a large space. Service was excellent too!

Went here as a special treat (as I’m definitely not well off enough to enjoy this regularly). But a treat it was! The food was so, so delicious. The scallops are out of this world and lived up to all the hype I’ve heard about them. Great location. Only critique, which cannot be helped, is the acoustics in the building. Sometimes it gets pretty loud and is hard to hear people across the table. However, I am a big fan! This was a great place to splurge on.

Absolutely one of the best dining experiences I’ve had. The staff was able to accommodate a last minute reservation time change on New Year’s Eve, after my daughter fell while skiing and was injured. We were treated exceptionally well, and our waitress Katie was AMAZING! The food was beautiful and delicious! I highly recommend this restaurant!

name: Siegfried's Delicatessen
address: 20 W 200 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews:
My friend and I stopped into this place on a whim and we are so glad we did! 
The feel of the place is very German. We were informed that they have been there for 70 years and I bet not much has changed. 
I ordered a cold corned beef sandwich with everything on it as well as red cabbage and warm potato salad on the side.
It was fantastic food and very German. The lady ringing up my order was very nice and attentive to my needs. 
After lunch we spent some time looking at all the other goodies and sweets they had to offer.
I will go back.

Siegfried's is one of my favorite lunch places in Salt Lake. Everything I have tried is delicious, but my all time favorite is the corned beef Rubin. It is absolutely delicious! Have that with a side of fried potatoes and you can't go wrong.

I am from Wyoming and my Mom was stationed in Germany before and she has an infinity for German food because of her living there but as part of our heritage and this place has a little bit of everything for someone!! I would visit this place weekly if we had a place like this in Wyoming!! They even have places to sit and enjoy your food as well daily lunch specials!! I can't wait to come back!

I have been here several times and usually get the schnitzel and bratwurst with spaetzle with gravy. They have a wide variety of German meats and treats like candy, chocolates, and packaged baked products. I've only ever had the freshly prepared food and the German soft drinks they sell by the check stand.

I like how, when you eat there, you get an actual plate and metal utensils, that are then left on the table. A worker then cleans up when you leave. It's a nice service for such an informal ambiance. They provide yellow mustard, spicy brown mustard, ketchup, and curry ketchup to go with your meal. There is not a ton of space here to sit, especially during busy times, so don't plan to go there if you have more than maybe four people in your party. There is approximately 16-24 places to sit. Enjoy!

Fun little place. I've been a few times, but recently went with my German sister-in-law so she showed me the things she grew up with (malt beer - they called it "kids beer", purple sauerkraut, and the sausage). Food isn't bad, I think I'm just not a huge fan of German food. Everything tends to have a similar texture and there's not a huge variety of flavor, but then again I love some good Indian or Mexican cuisine with loads of flavor!

I got the wienerschnitzel with sides of purple sauerkraut, potatoes, and cucumber and tomato salad and shared it with my wife. We weren't starving so it was enough for us.

name: Manoli's
address: 402 E 900 S #2, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: We loved Manolis! I hadn’t tried it earlier because when I looked at their menu they didn’t have a traditional Greek salad, which is typically my favorite. We decided to try it the other night and LOVED it! They have their own unique spin on Greek food and it was delicious! The hummus was amazing, along with the fresh cooked bread. I loved the Brussels sprout salad as well. We will be back!
I've only been here once, but I must say that it had great ambiance and wonderful food!  I plan to return soon. Great outdoor seating and lots of GF options!

Some of the best food in Salt Lake City. I can't stop thinking about it. We shared about 8 small plates and every one was out of this world. The desserts were also excellent, and the servers were friendly, attentive, and helpful.

I was so excited to finally give Manoli’s a try, I was putting it off until I had a chance to go with friends to share multiple dishes to get a real sense of this Greek flare. We started with the Yemista (stuffed piquillo peppers) and Tyropita (crispy stuffed phyllo dough). The Yemista was a bit too charred - had more of a burnt taste to them. The Tyropita has a unique flavor to it but it was tasty.  We continued with the Paidakia (lamb riblets), and Brizola (wagyu steak). Both of these were absolutely delicious! The lamb with capers chimichurri was so tender and tasty. Anytime I see wagyu steak on the menu I have to try it. It was paired with a celery root purée and pomegranate wilted radicchio - I thought it was perfect, others thought it was too sweet.  We also tried a buttermilk crusted quail    garnished with red pepper and feta cheese. The crust on the quail was a bit salty but the meat was tender and tasty.  We also ordered the Garides (grilled shrimp with Greek coffee bbq sauce), the sauce overpowered the amazing herbed polenta cake at the base of the dish.  The shrimp were overcooked and again the “char” tasted burnt. If I were to order this again I would mention the shrimp were overcooked last time and only add a light drizzle of the bbq sauce.  We finished with the Papia (seared duck breast), some of the sear on the duck was overdone and tasted burnt, and the butternut squash purée was cold.  The duck breast was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing but the garnishes missed the mark on this dish. We topped off the meal with soft serve ice cream garnished with all-spice, cherry reduction and toasted almonds - a nice refreshing finish with a little holiday flare from the all-spice.
We liked the place. Food is good and they cook everything very fast. Great service. Kind of expensive.

name: The Coffee Shop at Little America Hotel
address: 500 S Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: This may well be a Hidden Gem with The Travelers. But the locals absolutely love this fantastic place. There halibut and prime rib are to die for. All my kids love the turkey dinner. All food items are of high quality food. You always can get seconds or thirds on their magnificent rolls. It may be called a coffee shop but is more like fine dining.

Great atmosphere and great views of the city from street level. I had the Little America Burger that had Swiss cheese, onions, and mushrooms. It was very good, and you can really taste the difference in the wagyu beef patty. Our server, Patty, was so sweet. She overheard my daughter say it was my wife’s birthday, and Patty brought out a cake just before we were about to leave perfect timing nice little surprise.

We've been going here for quality comfort food for many years. Great prime rib. 

Comes with a fresh side salad with homemade dressing or homemade soup. The baked potatoes are fluffy packets of heavenliness. 

The vegetables are always fresh and not crunchy or mushy. The service very good, consistently. 

And the rolls are the best in Utah other than Maddox. Plus you can get some of their amazing raspberry jam if you ask. 

The Little America is the #1 best upper end comfort food in Utah.

Great spot for grub! Long wait on Holidays but one of the few where you will get awesome food at reasonable prices (considering everyone else is closed.) As long as you have the patience, dining here is wonderful. Crisp salad with perfect dressings, always served on the side. Dinner consist of full course meals, soup or salad, entree, potato, vegetables, rolls, and ice cream for dessert and everything else is prepared as much to precision. It really is a best deal on days everyone has rolled up and is staying home with their own families. Bless these people for being there for the rest of us! P.S. Decorations are also really hard to beat!

Our visit to the little American coffee shop was great 😁 met up with some friends to have breakfast here after reading some reviews, and we had a good time. We got seated at a table that was too small, so we were able to move to a bigger table. It took a little longer than regular wait times to get our food, but not too bad. I ordered two eggs with their "cottage-fried" potatoes and a biscuit and it was very filling. My husband got the poached eggs with Holondaise (however you spell it) sauce and he enjoyed them. My friends got the Southwest Omelet and the French Toast and they enjoyed their meals. It took awhile to get our checks and even longer to pay, which is where the 4 stars comes from. That and the price. This place is two $$, which is accurate. The average plate is around $10.99 and above. I don't think that price is reflective of the food in comparison to other breakfast places. Definitely worth a try here, and I imagine lunch/dinner is great from the reviews I've read.

name: Penny Ann's Cafe
address: 1810 S Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84115, USA
reviews: Brunch with your best friend is a mandatory event when you both are off for Christmas break so naturally we went to Penny Ann's. Their pancakes are lovely and their Eggs Benedict is high on my list of favorites. Good coffee. Great staff. Awesome place for brunch.

Always a great experience! Staff was very friendly and accommodating fro. The second we walk in to the moment we ask for our check. Food portions were generous and the Hot Cakes were simply amazing. I ordered the pot of gold and it was top notch. On our table, we also had the Southern Omelette and the French toast (that was loaded generously with Whipped Cream) and those were equally delicious.  Everything was seasoned perfectly and I wouldn't change a thing. Order the Penny Puffs when you can!! Would definitely recommend!

This cafe was great! It definitely had the small town feel to it and has a great atmosphere. Not necessarily the easiest place to find and parking can be tricky, but you can park on the street. There was a ton of food that came with the meal, definitely left feeling satisfied.

Loved our visit here! There's always a wait, so plan ahead for that. They say their pancakes are "famous" and I questioned why and talked about it with the waitress. Well, let me just say, THAT'S THE HONEST TRUTH. They mix something in that batter to make it just a smidge better than the rest of the pancakes I've eaten in my lifetime. I got the omelet that has jalapenos in it...I forget the name. Pretty spicy, so order with caution. My husband got the chicken and waffles and that was seriously SO COOL. They make the pancakes WITH the chicken, not just put on top. My kids got the pancakes and loved them, of course. I had a side of French toast and seriously, the pancakes blew them out of the water. Definitely worth a visit, and more!

Delicious classic breakfast food. We went around 10:45 on a weekday and there were empty tables, but you can tell they often have a wait. The server was incredibly efficient and the food came out very quickly. Portions were generous and everything was tasty.

name: Tuccis
address: 515 700 E #1D, Salt Lake City, UT 84102, USA
reviews: Absolutely fantastic Italian food and high-quality service in a very unique and pleasant atmosphere. The pasta was not overdone or over-the-top; it was simple Italian food at its best. The sauce, which can be especially hard for some to get right, was done perfectly, and the pasta-to-sauce ratio was right where it needed to be to properly enjoy all aspects of the dish. Also, our waitress was incredibly friendly and attentive. I'm definitely going back as soon as possible to get my Italian fix.
Incredible service! What a great local business to support right now. Everyone needs some classic Italian cooking, straight from Papa Tucci! LOVED the cannoli

Closest thing you can find to Italy in Salt Lake City. Food is fresh and cooked with dedication, recipes have a slight modern touch but tries to be consistent with the traditional recipes.

The downside of this place is that one server is covering too many tables and slows down the experience.

Overall our visit was delightful and we definitely will come back to give another chance, perhaps looking for a faster and more personalized service.

Tasty food :) I like the emphasis for an Italian like experience. The service is always fantastic and the place is constantly packed for dinner.
Try their specialty meat dishes; it will melt in your mouth. There are plenty of dining and dessert options. I recommend  trying out their Italian coffee. 
Drop by for a date or coming with your coworkers.

Christmas day and we weren't really in the mood to cook. Most places were closed for Christmas but not Tuccis. The service was great. Our waitress was very helpful the hostess was very kind and brought our little girl a treat just because. The manager came to our table and asked how we were doing just making sure we were taking care of. Great experience all around!

name: Red Iguana 2
address: 866 W S Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84116, USA
reviews: Very tasty, arrive early for smaller groups. Reservations are highly recommended for larger groups. Small parking lot next to building. Staff was quick and attentive. Everyone very much enjoyed their food and left very full. I kinda wish I'd left room for dessert but sadly enjoyed my meal too much. The moles are excellent get all of em and share!

A little bit of a wait, but well worth it! Great food and great value. Holey mole sauce!! With 6 different mole sauces to choose from you will certainly find a flavor to blow your mind, highly recommend!  Cocktails made with fresh squeezed juices are a fantastic touch as well, so refreshing

Delicious Mexican food! They are famous for their moles, but I'm not much of a fan of mole. All the other things I've had there have been very flavourful.  The portions are large so I have leftovers, which I like. Good service too! There isn't a lot of parking, but they do have another lot just down the road.

Great atmosphere, very welcoming and good food. Definitely a popular place! Seems like there's always a wait so getting a reservation is probably a good idea if you have time constraints. I got the Mole Negro, it was good (it was my first time having mole so I wasn't sure what to expect)

Just picked up curb side takeout from our favorite restaurant (we live in Lehi). So hoping that you are doing well during these hard times. People.... support small business, tip generously and support the businesses you love. Stay well, can’t wait to be able to sit in your restaurant and enjoy your food again when this social distancing is over.

name: Pretty Bird Chicken
address: 146 Regent St, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: Fresh chicken near me. The presentation of the chicken itself was enticing as you know we eat with our eyes first. The color palette of the sandwich has a nice hint of purple, with traces of green from the pickles. Not a sloppy presentation at all everything was stacked on top of each other perfectly. The chicken itself was delicious felt like it was made right there and then. Going mild I didn’t get that extra kick from the spice but was hoping for more unique taste from the chicken, still the balance of the veggies on the sandwich was great. The customer service was great especially Brian who made it feel like I was a home eating some cozy chicken. I definitely would give it a try if your in the area.

Excellent fried chicken and spices! Medium spice was like medium salsa hot. Tiny seating inside but decent outside. Free parking garage next door too. Great addition would be chicken strips. The chicken breast was huge and a bit hard to eat. Highly recommend!

This place was cool. Great branding and atmosphere. It’s tiny! Service was good. Food didn’t live up to the hype and the spice was spicy! Definitely worth trying though. 

I didn’t care for the dipping sauce

Pretty birds amazing! This was my first time eating here. The place is clean and the staffs friendly and attentive.  I had the HOT chicken sandwich and it was HOT but amazing! Cant wait to go back and bring the family.  Highly recommended!

Simply the best chicken sandwich I've ever had. 
It's huge, it's tasty, it's everything you've ever wanted. 
The spices are wonderful. A slow heat, with a bit of sweetness. 
I'm not crazy about the fries, but they're decent. Love the simple menu and small intimate feel.
I wish they'd do something to improve their outdoor seating. It's in the shade and downright cold in the winter. The outdoor furniture is also uncomfortable. I only point this out because there's like less than 10 spots to sit inside.

name: Pallet
address: 237 400 W, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: Don’t get me wrong, the food is great. I just wasn’t very pleased with my experience here. To start with, they don’t make it clear that if you get still water instead of ice water, you will be charged $6 per bottle. Second, it was my friends birthday and we brought a mini cake in. The server let us know there would be a cake cutting fee for $3 per person. We asked if we could cut it ourselves and she said she could probably get the fee waived. We decided to order two desserts from them as well. Our server never cut our cake and never even brought us a knife. We ate the cake with our forks.  When she brought the bill out, she said she could not get the cake cutting fee waived. I’m not a cheap person and complaining about prices here, I just think it’s a little ridiculous that I was charged an extra $9 on my bill for nothing. Not to mention we ordered two desserts from the restaurant so I don’t see why it was an extra $9 to bring in a cake from somewhere else. Another note, the server grabbed my friends phone right out of her hands. That isn’t very professional and the whole situation rubbed me the wrong way.

We had a lovely Valentine’s Day dinner at Pallet!

The music, lighting, art and table set up makes for an intimate and warm atmosphere, even with the exposed brick and industrial decor. 

Most likely unique to valentines day, we enjoyed the prix fix menu and wine pairing.  The food was creative and tasty, with unique flavor profiles and layered textures. Neither of us have had any of the five dishes as they were presented before, so it was a unique and memorable experience. The oysters, pear and fennel salad, potatoes, scallops, waygu beef and chocolate mouse was a delight. 

Service was great from start to finish. 

Additionals : Parking was easy to find for free, across the street.. Bathrooms were clean. Reservation process was easy. 

Constructive feedback: if only offering a prix fix menu for a specific night, please advise at time of reservation. My husband had done a ton of research on the menu, only to find out about the prix fix when we were seated.

Every part of it experience here was fantastic. The ambiance was fantastic and the staff were very welcoming. The menu was small but thoughtful and everything we ordered was seasoned and cooked to perfection. The Black Cod with Israeli couscous and harissa was a show stopper.
Excellent food, flavor and cooked perfectly. I had a NY strip. My date had a bass. Excellent. Highly recommend. Family style seating is where we were, but they do have tables as well, just gotta ask.

Amazing spot with a great menu and great service. Most of the restaurants in SLC are chains or extremely overrated but Pallet is one of the rare exceptions. Loved the ambience its versatility as a spot for a great meal before a game, entertaining clients or a special occasion.

name: Fleming’s Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar
address: 20 400 W #2020, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: I typically love going here but the food wasn't as good this time around. Our brussel sprouts and cauliflower were under cooked, the tuna had fat or skin or something making it really chewy. The steak was great, but paying extra for 1 tiny lump of crab meat wasn't worth it. Their whipped cream with berries is always my favorite, this time around we only had a dollop of cream and no strawberries. I would recommend the French onion soup, NY Steak, and anything with whipped cream!

We came in for our Anniversary and it was so amazing. It was super romantic and quiet. We had awesome service and our waiter had amazing recommendations. The chefs cauliflower was Insane! My Kobe steak was sooo perfectly medium rare and so much flavor! We will for sure be back and I can’t wait!
Fleming's is consistently amazing. Well worth it. Service is impeccable.

The food was delicious, and the service was great! We ended up at a table in one of the side rooms, so even though it was pretty packed, it didn't feel that way. As mentioned in some of the other reviews, the steak was a bit fatty, but it was still delicious. Definitely recommend getting the crab on top. Lauren was great about checking in, but not being obnoxious about it. She made it very enjoyable. The lava cake was amazing as well! Would definitely recommend coming here for a nice meal. We came to celebrate my husband getting a new job and they had a card and truffles for him at the end of our meal. Great experience.

I don't get it. I mean they nail the ambience and presentation, but the food is mostly just overcomplicated. Too many flavors competing, not to mention steak that tastes like dirt. 

The main thing this place has going for it is that you can get a good steak without needing to wade through peanut shells and listen to country music. But that steak will cost you 3-4x more and it is *not* 3-4x better. Maybe 50% better?? Just don't do the dry aged steak. I've had good dry aged steak. It still tasted like steak, with some flavor. This just tasted like dirt. I ate 4 or 5 bites before I couldn't do any more, and that was a $60 steak. If I come back I will order the simplest steak they offer. And the molten chocolate lava cake. Absolutely the best I've ever had.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House
address: 275 S. West Temple Street, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews:
Went here for my wedding anniversary.
One of, if not the best steak dinners I've ever had. Had the T bone steak, along with the french onion soup. Fabulous!  Also had the caramelized banana cream pie for dessert. Delicious!
My wife had the stuffed chicken breast and loved it.
Service was great.
Expensive for a regular guy like me, but worth it for the special occasion.
Highly recommended.👍👍

We enjoyed our meal here. The service was first class. I was recommended the venison which was sweet and perfectly cooked. A little on the rich side if that’s what you’re looking for. Most people here are coming for the steak. My wife got that and we enjoyed it as well. All servings were large and generous. We also enjoyed the Brussels sprouts. The scalloped potatoes were a little bit on the undercooked side and nothing different from what you could make it home. Overall, you know what you are coming for and they’re consistent every time. Make sure to call and make reservations ahead otherwise you could be waiting for a long time.

Excellent. My wife and I split the cowboy steak for Valentine's dinner. I also got and recommend the Ruth's Chris salad. It was very delicious.

The steak was the most perfect medium I have ever gotten anywhere.

Been here many times. Wait staff is always delightful and attentive. The steaks are top notch. The sides are pretty good, but for a meal this expensive, I would expect a little more. The lobster Mac and cheese was a little soupier than usual, and the fingerling potatoes were disappointing. The flavor was nice, but they were tough and low on forkability. The key lime pie for dessert was unique and delicious!

Staff were very attentive and friendly. They did a good job explaining the different items on the menu when we had questions, and offered kids options for my niece who joined us. The food was amazing. Be sure to try the sweet potatoes for a delicious sweet side. The garlic mashed potatoes were also delicious.

name: Garden Café
address: 555 S Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: The food was very good. Everything at this hotel is great.

Stopped by for brunch. It’s was an enjoyable experience. First time visitors receive a short tour. They had crab legs and sushi, Eggs Florentine, omelettes, pancake, waffles, prime rib, desert stations and more. There are lots of options to choose from. I received a nice little rose which was an extra treat. What a lovely place.
Delicious and great service! The band makes it way fun
We were there for Branch, celebrating my friend's birthday.  Food is really good, atmosphere is amazing. But its a little bit expensive. Only for very special occasion. VERY VERY special occasion!

Very nice brunch. The setting is perfect, well lit and perfect for meeting someone new.

The brunch was delicious with many options. The omlete was great, and all salad options were spot on.

The cocktails could improve significantly.

name: La Estación Del Taco
address: 125 S Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: OMG. The best tacos around. Totally authentic with an incredible set of toppings to choose from. Lengia asada and so much more.

This is the place! This is where you want to get your fix.

Tacos $1.50
Burrito $6

Delicious! Lady is very nice.
Best tacos in Salt Lake City! The salsa was so good and spicy! Affordable and the ladies are so nice.

I don't usually write reviews, but this taco cart is amazing!  I walk just over two blocks once or twice per week.  The carnitas burrito is my go to, but I have tried a couple of others, and the tacos are great too.  They are very kind, and the service is great.  Highly recommend!
Perfect for a quick lunch if you work downtown. Very good tacos and friendly staff. Prices are very reasonable too. The stand is under some trees so you'll be eating in a nice shaded area

name: Spencer's For Steaks & Chops
address: 255 S W Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: Amazing food and great service. We had Hayley B as our server and she was one of the best waitresses we ever had. Overall the staff was well versed in how to treat travelers.  Steak was sublime and the gnocchi was also very good.

The food was well prepared and the ambience was amazing! The only reason I rate this 5 stars is because of RENE he came to fill up our water and check up on us more than the actual server! He had a huge smile and amazing attitude the entire time! He was very entertaining and had amazing stories to tell! I will be returning solely because of him.

Horrible tonight!  I have been here many times and it has always been great.  Our steaks were cold and it took forever to get them.  The service was terrible.  We waited 30 min for drink refills.  Salads were not impressive. 45 minutes went by then when the steaks  came to our table they were cold. Also, the steaks came 10 min before our sides.  The sides were fine. Then we waited another 30 min with nobody coming to our table to check on us. Someone in our party had to go ask for the manager. The person at the front desk said the manager was out!   Out?  It’s valentines weekend. No manger on duty ??? 15 min later some guy came to our table and asked us what our problem is as if we didn’t have anything to complain about. We waited forever... Nobody asked us if we wanted desert.  The bill finally came and we waited 20 more minutes to get our credit cards back.  

We would have had better luck at Sizzler tonight. I would have ordered malibu chicken and a salad and been happy with an extra $80 in my pocket.  

“They so poo poo” - Tyler Huntley

Forgive the unattractive pictures, haha. But this place is awesome! Potato gratin was fantastic. And I got the New York Strip steak, medium, and it was amazing. Calamari was fantastic as well! And the tomato bisque was delicious! This place obviously isn't cheap, but if you're looking for a delicious steak at a higher-end restaurant, Spencer's is great. Service was excellent as well! The establishment was very clean and classy. Great experience overall!

My group had a great experience at this restaurant. The food was delicious. I had the chops, along with a wide range of starters and side dishes. Everything was full of flavor and spiced perfectly. 

The staff was attentive and friendly. They stayed on top of drinks and weren't overbearing.

The atmosphere is quintessential steak house. So are the prices...it's not a place to feed your family on the cheap. But worth it.

name: Whiskey Street Cocktails & Dining
address: 323 S Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: We did not have reservations, but the staff got us in on a cancellation/no show. We loved the Oyster bar as well as the drinks and fun conversation with the bar tender. I had the duck, my wife had small bird and the other couple had steak. The food was amazing. The vibe was upbeat and pleasant. WE WILL BE BACK!!

I had no idea there were so many types of Whiskey! Or even the difference between a bourbon, a single malt and the countless other categories of a drink that pretty much tastes the same to me ... however, I did try a single malt which was within a reasonable price range and which was so delicious I had to have a couple more in the span of a couple of hours during which I experimented a few dishes from their food menu. Bar tenders were top experts and very helpful answering my basic questions so I give this place a top mark for delicious food, excellent drinks options but a word of warning ... some of these whiskey's are a couple of hundred dollars a shot and sadly outside my budget ... even though I was really tempted, be careful.

Awesome selection of booze. Service is usually great. My most recent experience however was a one-off not great one. I received a drink I didn't like. Since I was with company I didn't want to complain but didn't drink it. Having been a waitress at many restaurants,  I know great service would ask questions about a drink or meal barely touched, especially at a bar known for their drink selection. Partly on me for not saying something, but still I believe a 5-star rating should reflect a place I can always depend on to keep me happy.

Terrible service from our waiter and manager.  We showed up for Sunday brunch 2 hours before a show.  It took the server 30 minutes to take our order, when we ordered we let him know that we had to leave for a show in 90 minutes.  We then waited 60 minutes with no food, we continually checked with our server to see where our food was and he assured us it would be right out.  When we only had 30 minutes before we had to leave, with assurances that our food would be right out multiple times, we paid for our meal so we would be able to get out on time.  At this point the server reminded us that there was an entire bar full of people that he needed to take care of, not just us.  

After another 20 minutes, we flagged down the hostess (who was very nice the whole time and helped us flag down our waiter to place our initial order) and asked her to check where our food was.  She came back and let us know there were still 2 people ahead of us.  At this point we asked for our money back so we could get out of there and make our show.  The manager worked with us to get us a refund and offered no apology for the wait.  

I understand that they were busy and the waiter was very busy and under a lot of stress, I would only ask that you be transparent and let us know our food won't be out on time and we would have left and gone somewhere else.  Don't continually assure us for 90 minutes, only to let us know at the last minute!

Had the pork belly sandwich with a nice porter. It was one of the best meals I've had in the area. Atmosphere was a little loud. But sociable and comfortable at the same time. Amazing whiskey and beer selection from what I tried. Definitely will comeback 
whenever chance I get.

name: Pago
address: 878 900 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84102, USA
reviews: Parking was a little difficult. The food was good. The server we had was the best part of our experience. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and the wine list. I would recommend checking the menu before going. On Sunday daytime they have only a brunch menu, most of the options I was not interested in. Not their fault, mine for not doing my homework before making reservations. They do take reservations and I am told it's a good idea to do so. They have an extensive wine list that changes frequently. The restaurant was clean

This restaurant is really nice. Our waiter Chase was awesome, always making sure we have everything we need and also gave us some very good food recommendations. I felt some of the dishes were a little small (like the beet salad) but the taste was awesome!!

Thoughtful, delicious food. Incredible burger, and my husband described the scrambled eggs as “the most perfect scrambled eggs ever.” Many restaurants seem to think that the only way to add flavor is to make food spicy. I was grateful that wasn’t the case here, although spicier options are available. Jordan was our server, and he had a genuine enthusiasm for not only Pago, but craft food in general.

Today we had an amazing experience with their new project (we hope it is there to stay after COVID), meal pairing with wine recommendation from Scott Evans. The way it worked: you order a meal from Pago and buy a wine to pair with food and join the live session on Facebook. Food was amazing, wines complemented the food perfectly! If they happen to do this in the future my recommendation is to keep food warm in the oven.

great restaurant! authentic is the word the comes to mind when thinking of pago. the food tastes great and the wine selection is decent but with excellent prices. the pork chop or sea bass would be my recommendation. the burger is good, but fries are a bit too salty

name: Bombay House
address: 2731 E Parleys Way, Salt Lake City, UT 84109, USA
reviews:
Love this place. It starts getting packed around 5:30pm and  there are no reservations, so expect to wait a little while. 

The food is amazing but takes awhile to come out. We were there for my birthday and they took great care of us even though we were in a little rush for an event after dinner.

Their Custer care is fantastic. If you like Indian cuisine, at least give this place a shot.

It takes an orchestra to perform a symphony with it's full depth and beauty, the wonderful people at Bombay House understand this concept well and execute a similar level of precision and unified goal every day. The goal? Provide exquisite Indian cuisine with a high level of customer service. I can't say enough about how well they achieve this goal. A prime example is that I ordered a beer and while the waiter was taking the rest of our order, another server came with my beer and a chilled glass. I was taken aback and truly impressed by how quickly they were able to operate as a team to serve us. Don't even get me started about the food itself-it was fantastic. The spices in every dish were perfectly balanced and the different heat levels were well crafted to ensure that the hotter spice levels are just as enjoyable as the mild dishes to the non-spicy food lover.
