If you are a fan of Indian cuisine (or even if you aren't), you would be remiss to not give Bombay House a try.

They're the definition of going above & beyond! I could not be more pleased with their service! The food speaks for itself. I'm never disappointed with the food. With an uncertain estimated time on when the food would be ready, long story short, they cut my wait time from an hour, to twenty minutes, and called me to let me know my food was ready with five minutes to spare, yup! 15 minutes! Love this place & their hospitality!

I absolutely love Bombay House. Unfortunately, my usual order includes subbing coconut milk for cream in 2 dishes due to a lactose allergy. The online ordering system does not allow me to do this and calling in an order is no longer an option. Sad that I can’t get takeout from here anymore.

Friendly staff and great food. We enjoyed the poppadoms with relishes to start. My husband had a chicken korma (prepared mild) and I had a vegetable curry (prepared medium). Both flavorful and with requested spice level. The mango drink was good too. Excellent staff. Would recommend visiting :)

name: Market Street Grill - Downtown
address: 48 W Market St, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews:
We went there for our anniversary at around 4:30 pm. We got sat quickly, as we were one of two tables there at the time. We sat for approximately 10 minutes before we saw a server.  Server 1: brought us water and took our appetizer order. Server 2: brought the appetizer out to us. 
The calamari was delicious. 
Server 2: came to check on us after we consumed about half the appetizer and asked how everything was and if we needed anything. 
I said, yes, for someone to take our order. 
Server 2: looked dumb founded, like Server 1, didn’t take it?  
We ordered our meals. Ahi Tuna & Crab Cakes, both with clam chowder and mashed potatoes. Soup came out quickly, and delicious. We waited about 15 minutes before Server 2 came over and advised us that “the kitchen is having a mashed potato crisis”.  It would be another 5 minutes for our meal to come out. Okay, whatever.  6 minutes later, Server 2 came out and said it will be another 30 minutes, unless we order a different starch. Needles to say, we ordered a different starch. We waited again for approximately, 15 min.  The food was delicious. But, I’m surprised the manager didn’t come out to apologize. We were charged for the full bill even. 

This is a matter of maybe I’ll go back. But not anytime soon.

First time there and it was very nice inside and they even brought cinnamon rolls to the table. Our waitress was very welcoming and warm with us and I enjoyed the experience. Can't wait to go back for more!

The staff, servers and hosts, are wonderful. Been going there for brunch for almost 20 years, but am thinking that will have to end.
With the change of ownership, the prices have increased (not horribly) and the quality of the food has taken a real drop.
Sorry to see this all come to an end.

Very friendly staff, excellent service, the best drinks in town, a wide variety of specials. Be sure to ask your server about daily specials and fresh fish flown in on a daily basis. It's currently crab season so be sure to try the crab specials, my favorite is the mac and cheese. Brunch is served until 4 on Sunday, which comes with delicious complimentary cinnamon rolls. Breakfast is always served promptly, within minutes, so whether you're in a rush for a quick bite or just wanting to spend your time with an endless cup of coffee, this is the place to be.

Excellent service (thank you Heath!), Excellent food, and reasonable prices. Wife and I each had an entree with big bowls of clam chowder first, 3 drinks each and a shared dessert for $120 total. A great meal, we will definitely be back.

name: Rodizio Grill - Salt Lake City - Dine-In Open
address: 600 700 E 2nd Floor, Salt Lake City, UT 84102, USA
reviews:
The meat just keeps coming. They have a good variety but my definite favorites are the grilled pineapple and ham.  Gotta love the Hawaiian combo.

The chicken heart was surprisingly tasty, I'm glad I had one.

Very good restaurant if you like meat. Their meals include their salad bar. I usually get very little from the salad bar to save room for more meat. Their salad bar had a pot roast soup that was very delicious.
The meats were delicious, I really enjoyed the garlic beef. Then it is good to finish off with their grilled pineapple.

Smiles all around here! We came for a very late Valentine's dinner. It was busy like usual and we had to wait a while even tho we made a reservation but overall it was a great experience! Our check came quickly, we always had drinks and food on our plates and everyone was very nice. We even accidentally dropped a fork on the floor and instantly an employee was there to offer a clean one... It was magical really 😂 such a good time! ❤️

One of the best Brazilian restaurants in town. Sometimes it’s hard to get a table especially in December other than that it is amazing. I have been there many times and the food always delicious. Their best is the garlic steak and the parmigiana steak . They also have pineapple. It tastes good. I’ll definitely come back.

Such a fun experience.  The meats are so yummy and of course the grilled pineapple. I love the Brazilian lemonades and all the choices at the salad bar will not leave you hungry. My 9 year old who is still a picky eater actually ended up loving her dinner. It is noisy and a lot going on but over all we had a great time. They also sing the funnest song and play a drum for birthday celebrations.  We're already planning who's birthday we would like to go back for.

name: Osteria Amore
address: 224 1300 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84102, USA
reviews: My husband and I were very impressed and had a great experience! The atmosphere was awesome, the service was exceptional and the food was delicious. Best Italian food in Utah for sure! Our waiter was very attentive and accommodating. The food was reasonably priced as well.
Best Italian restaurant in town! Really good food for reasonable price. Will try pizza next time and let you know. Enjoy
Amazing pizza. Cooked perfectly with a nice crust. So many places undercook their pizza. Great job. Can’t wait to come back!

If you’ve ever longed to feel like you’re surrounded by your dearest friends, while enjoying innovative and classic Italian fare, you should come home to Osteria Amore. 
The blend of Northern and Southern Italian flavors and traditional dishes will send you back to your grandma’s kitchen(s). You can feel the love packed in each bite... it’s amore!
Great atmosphere. Awesome food. Excellent Service. Pistachio sauce on the pasta that I got was amazing. Shout out to Mom in the back making the ricotta spread for the butter!

name: Oquirrh Restaurant
address: 368 E 100 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews:
This place was amazing.  We got the beef tar tar as an appetizer.  Our entire table loved it.  It had a super slight hint of something spicy.

For dinner we got the steak and fish of the day.  The steak was cooked perfectly.  The sauce it was paired with had me lucky the plate clean.  The fish on the other hand didn't look the best BUT it blew our mind.  The liquid it was served with paired incredibly well with the fish.

O. Top of that, the owner came by our table and chatted for a little while.  It was an overall great experience.

What an AMAZING place. Don't be thrown off by the location, this place is a posh, trendy, foodie, hot and up and coming place. The food is unique but well worth it. The staff is friendly and the management greets you and values your feedback. Angie (Angelina is a gem) the food is unique i tried the carrots, the milk potatoes, the lamb which is to die for, and the dessert. Drinks are unique and worth the buzz. Try this spot while in town if you are not a local its worth the short walk from the downtown area, if your a local stop by and say hi to them. Just wanted to say thank you so much for your hospitality.

Magical night. The food, the atmosphere, and the music. Perfect. Ang the owner came and sat with us. We talked food and life. What a perfect evening. And wait... did i mention the menu? The highest quality. Try the pot pie. And the Lamb. And the sourdough. And...

Delicious, innovative, and beautifully crafted plates. The setting is quiet and the service is excellent. My only complaint is the server who touches you every time she comes to the table. Maybe I am truly that irresistible but sadly I don’t draw the same attention elsewhere

I brought our company here for an amazing experience! The food was to die for the the owner even worked  with me to make sure they could accommodate us beforehand. Very few upscale places in SLC will host 15+ but they did it with a smile! We loved meeting the owners and chef's too! Would totally come back.

name: Pig & A Jelly Jar Salt Lake City
address: 401 E 900 S A, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews:
Ordered online for curbside pickup. Staff was very friendly, everyone was wearing gloves. No guests were allowed in the building (which is excellent). I could tell everyone was taking health and cleanliness VERY seriously. The food was hot and delicious. I would have attached a picture but my husband and I ate the food too quickly!
I love supporting local businesses we love, especially in a time of need. They even included a sparkler with instructions to light it at 9 pm tonight to spread joy. LOVE that!

So awesome! Quality service and a great menu selection. I enjoyed the Sausage Gravy over Biscuits, and it was a delightful savory treat. The biscuits were a crispy golden brown, and there was the perfect amount gravy to coat all of the biscuits without smothering them. It also comes served with an over easy egg on top, which was a tasty addition. I also appreciate that all of the ingredients are locally sourced. I didn't have the chance to try the alcohol options today, but maybe next time. A great selection, and served all day!
I will recommend this place to anyone looking for a good brunch or cafe experience.

Normally I love this restaurant and they have great food and service while dining in, but they are having serious issues with organizing to go orders at this time. Ordered through their app at 11:10 AM with an estimated time of the 11:58 for the order to be ready for pickup. By 12:55, after waiting outside the restaurant for an hour, all they could tell me is “it’s still going to be awhile.” They were happy to refund the order for me, but something needs to seriously change about their online ordering before I go back.

Cozy up beat cafe.  Parking is ample. Service is excellent. Food was delicious!  I found the place to be very comfortable inside clean and modern.  Very inviting. Prices were reasonable. Check it out!

I wish I could remember my servers name.  It has been a hot minute since I have been in there but we always had one of two servers and they were beyond awesome.  Made suggestions, laughed with us, talked nerdy stuff(gaming) with us.  Just a great atmosphere.  I mean the food is awesome to.  Well i only get the waffle and eggs because i'm addicted.  But they are amazing.

name: Martine Cafe
address: 22 E 100 S #200, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: This is a great small-plate restaurant. It is a little expensive but the food is quite good. The staff was extremely friendly and make some great recommendations. For a fancy restaurant the service was very fast. Great spot for a special occasion.

Absolutely Amazing. Attentive, friendly and knowledgeable servers. The food was cooked to perfection. I got the mussels and Clams and I cannot say enough about the sauce, it was the perfect balance. My husband had the Sea Bass, it was inspired cooked perfectly and the best hummus I have ever tried. If that was not enough, the fried gingerbread is a must, we had them put ice cream on the side, normally comes on top. Bread was crispy on the outside, tender on the inside with a beautiful mix of spices. Great Date Night experience.
Wonderful atmosphere and super personal service. The food was crisp and yummy. Will clearly recommend this restaurant to anyone. Fair rates and large portions. Good job.

I came here with my husband and we both had a really good time. It's at a great location across from City Creek, the building is historic and very cool, the service was very fast, and the food was delicious. I had salmon, and my husband had the burger. I can't wait to come back and try something new.

I really wanted to like this place. My wife and a split the brisket burger and it waassss less than stellar. The meet was soft, like raw meet, but it wasn't pink at all. Mine was cold as ice in the middle.

The fries were great, and the fries brussel sprouts were great! However, overall disappointing.

name: Table X
address: 1457 E 3350 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84106, USA
reviews: We have come to Table X for our last two anniversaries. We love to get the chefs tasting menu along with the wine pairings. Don’t worry that you won’t be full enough! I struggled to finish my last plate even though it was delicious. The menu is so unique and the staff is incredible. Highly recommend.

The food was amazing. Staff was knowledgeable, attentive and fun. I’d highly recommend eating here. They have a garden out back where they get several of the fresh ingredients for the meals. They make their own bread, ice cream, cheese.. so good!

I have wanted to go to table X for quite a while now and it definitely lived up to the hype. Every dish was carefully thought out and planned and tasted exquisite.  This was some of the best lamb I've ever had not to mention the perfect risotto and Berkshire pork.  I am confident that I could live on their fresh baked bread and gin and tonics alone.

I took my husband here last night for his birthday. We chose the chefs 5 course meal for the both of us. My husband decided we wanted to be surprised with the food to get the whole experience. They first brought out raw oysters which were not my cup of tea. They also brought out a celery root risotto with brown butter. That was delicious. Next was the salmon which we both really liked. After that was steak. The steak was cooked very well and had lots of flavor. We were both disappointed in the bread pudding for dessert. It just fell short on flavor. For the price tag vs flavor we won’t be returning. And yes my husband and I have been to many 5 star restaurants in various states. The staff was incredible and truly try to make it an experience for you. Food could just use more flavor.

I've never been to a fancy restaurant before table x but it was amazing. We did the chef's tasting menu and the food was amazing! All of the staff was super friendly and really on top of everything. It was definitely a lot more expensive than I'm used to but for a special occasion I cant think of a better place

name: The Roof
address: 15 E S Temple 10th floor, Salt Lake City, UT 84150, USA
reviews:
Great food, great atmosphere, great service, and great people. 
My wife and I came here for our anniversary and we received excellent service. The food was great. Make sure that you save some room for desserts because those may have been the highlight the cream Brulé was amazing.

The Roof is a great place to eat, but a big part of the experience is the location and view.  It's just an incredible place to eat dinner.  The food was amazing.  I do agree with some reviews that the selection isn't huge, but there's plenty of options for people with all different tastes, and if you leave this place hungry it's absolutely undeniably your own fault.  If you have limited your own food choices due to lifestyle decisions, you can't blame someone else for not catering specifically to you at a buffet setting.  You are responsible to choose a restaurant that matches your eating lifestyle.  The dessert bar was so good I felt like I had to try everything, which is why I'm not eating much of anything today (the next day).  The ONLY two negatives from the experience was ice cold stuffed mushrooms (maybe they're supposed to be that way?) and I took a piece of steak that was absolutely raw.  However, the chef sent out a new platter of steaks and they were outstanding.

This is not exactly the food I was expecting for this price range. Extremely limited seating although the view is a spectacular view of the city. Staff is professional and prompt but more creative options of healthy warm and fresh vegetables would be nice, as well as a more unique and quality dessert selection. A fuller salad bar with fully stocked fresh larger selections would also be nice. Although it was a lovely view. And the people were polite and friendly. It did feel like an upscale dining experience.

Last night was very typical of our other visits to this amazing restaurant. Our server Julie, was as good as our previous server on other occasions Janet. They are both exceptional and if you visit the roof you might want to ask for Julie or Janet. As usual the food was sensational. One of the bright spots was the amazing piano player. Another welcome was how amazing Andrew Last night was very typical of our other visits to this amazing restaurant. Our server Julie, was as good as our previous server on other occasions Janet. They’re both exceptional and if you visit the roof you might want to ask for Julie or Janet. As usual the food was sensational. One of the bright spots was the amazing piano player. Another welcome was how amazing Andrew us  Andrew made sure that we got our favorite table, even though that is not something that they can guarantee. And your work very hard to make sure we had the table and the view we were looking for. He even came by our table on two other occasions, as he did the other tables, to make sure we were taking care of perfectly. The roof is just one of those restaurants that happens to be on our favorite list and every time we go we are reminded why it is on that list. If you looking for a fine dining experience this restaurant needs to be on your list.

We had the dinner the last day when we visit the city. Very nice view of Tabernacle and the temple. it has live piano playing. it's a buffet style and the food quality is good. it's a good place for special celebration.

name: Cucina
address: 1026 2nd Ave, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews: Valentine's dinner, fabulous! Love the service and personal stopby from the owner. Food beyond delicious.
The food was so delicious! It also looks like a fun place to sit outside and have a glass of wine in warmer weather.
Quaint restaurant. Not a ton of options for lunch but I will definitely be going back. Lots of great looking pastries and dinner menu. Very friendly staff, and great atmosphere
Their homemade fare makes for a great meal.  Well above average with excellent service and a nice atmosphere.  A few dishes have lacked some consistency and flavor.

What a wonderful experience! We came for dinner the patio, the food was amazing, we had the avocado bomb thing...the cashew candy in the middle, yum! We also had frozen sangria, just what a perfect patio night needed! We had a few other unique dishes, the homemade pasta and also the Romanesco broccoli, both are a must!

name: Arempas
address: 350 S State St, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: Always DELICIOUS! I’m Venezuelan and this is definitely authentic and delicious Venezuelan food. It makes me so happy to have an option to get my nostalgic childhood favorites here in salt lake. Thank you!!!

The plantain sandwiches are absolutely amazing. They are filling enough for us bigger guys and taste out of this world. They have 2 types of plantain crispy green or soft sweet. Pi prefer the green because I can pick up the sandwich while I need to use a fork and knife on the sweet.

Arempas is my favorite! The food is amazing and true to Venezuelan cuisine. The owner is Venezuelan, so the recipes are perfect! The menus are great as they are very detailed and explain the cuisine for those who may not be familiar. Great location too. They usually have Venezuelan drinks as well. I recommend everything but my favorite dish is the Patacón!

Do yourself a favor and check out this charming establishment. The food is always great (great price, too!), the staff are ALWAYS friendly, and it’s open crazy late on the weekends! I would recommend beating the bar-close rush, as people tend to flood in around then. 👍

Food was so authentic and delicious. I actually couldn’t have asked for anything more. But further, the service and sense of community was unparalleled. These guys genuinely care about giving their clients the most authentic Venezuelan cuisine you could ever hope to experience in Salt Lake City. I cannot speak highly enough about this hardworking and authentic flavor of Venezuela that you could ever come close to in salt lake city.  Don’t think twice. Come eat their food.

name: Em's
address: 271 Center St W, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews: So sad to see Emily retire! Good for her but Em’s will be missed. Loved every chance we had to come to Em’s. Never left Hungary or disappointed. Thank you Emily for running such a dynamite operation.

Wonderful little place! I love the atmosphere and the delightfully dated 90s menu. I can only give 4 stars for our visit this evening because we got stuck at a table in a wierd converted coffee shop side room. I much prefer the room with windows. Food was great, as always.

Em's is located in a quiet neighborhood up by the capital.  The setting is quiet and private for the most part.  I had the beef tenderloin and it was fantastic, my wife's first choice was baked risotto chicken which sold out so she settled for the New York strip, the flavor and tenderness was not as good as it could have been.  The staff was kind and courteous.

Em's is a quaint little café that had a warm and inviting atmosphere. The building itself was older in style, but that made it all the better. The food was good, though the menu wasn't extensive. The service was great and helpful. The coffee was self serve, which was nice when we wanted a refill. The portion sizes were appropriate for a Sunday brunch, and left us satisfied. Great place to visit and eat!
Excellent! Atmosphere, service, and food are superb.

name: Lucky H Bar & Grille
address: 500 S Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: The atmosphere, the food, the waitresses/waiters are excellent. The bar was nice and clean. We will definitely come back again. The experience here was incredible. Thank you for treating our family well! If I had to list a downside to the experience was that desert was a bit underwhelming and the amount of food provided was wasteful.

Overall, this is a good restaurant. Food was good quality and flavors were fine. Environment is very nice though. Compared to other places to get a nice steak, Lucky H is definitely not the best. For the price, the steak was plain and didn’t stand out at all. Overpriced in general. We had large party, which I know can be tough in ways but man, the service was so slow and getting our checks took an hour after we finished. We probably won’t go back, there’s other places that are just better in that price range. But you probably won’t regret going, if you do.

I feel like this is a hidden gem! Romantic. Quiet. Amazing quality, well prepared. You're not going to get anything wild and crazy but what you can expect is high quality.

The breakfast buffet is to die for. They make the baked goods on site. Eat the muffins, rolls and pastries. This is not a time to diet.

And we saw John Huntsman Jr eating there too so you might see some Utah royalty. 

This has become a family tradition to do the breakfast buffet around Christmas.

There's usually not a long wait like the coffee shop. Best date night place too!

I love the lunch buffet here. The salad bar is fantastic. They usually have prime rib and turkey as well as other great options for the main course. The dessert bar will have something for just about everyone. The problem here is definitely making room to try everything that looks appealing. That and focusing once you get back to work.
Good atmosphere..Good service... Better than Chuck a Rama,  slightly better... Not phenomenal... high priced breakfast bar.. Fun occasionally though.

name: Kyoto Japanese Restaurant
address: 1080 E 1300 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84105, USA
reviews: It was a very warm atmosphere in here when we walked in. The host, chefs and server were all on point. Authentic Japanese fare is really a treat and the price was right. I think the music needs some work, it was sombre like a sorrowful dirge so let's turn that off and play something more festive. Alright?!

The environment is great, is Japanese tatami style, some waitress wear kimono. I ordered uni, Bad smell and also taste bad way. It’s bad experience for this. No waiter asked our feedback. And also missed one shrimp when they served my dishes. I told the waiter three times then he said okay, I will bring you the missing one. Anyway, here is the place I don’t want to come back.

I feel torn about this place. My sushi was awesome.  The gyoza was good. The staff were nice. 

The booths set down in the ground are awkward to get in and out of. 
The place wasn’t super clean. 
There was a piece a paper in our gyoza dipping sauce. 

I’d be open to trying this place again but I think it’s overrated currently. 

I got the firecracker roll and enjoyed it.

Best Japanese restaurant in SLC hands down! We love their sushi and recommend the agadashi tofu for a starter. The service is fast and conscientious. We enjoy splitting a bottle of their plum wine as a table. We got their green tea mochi for dessert last time and it was delicious!! Definitely visit this authentic restaurant if you get the chance.

I visit this lovely spot often! This is my favorite restaurant to pass a nice evening.  I visit this spot regularly. The food is very good, the staff is welcoming and the rates are decent. I enjoy going in this restaurant to have a rich supper.

name: Sapa
address: 722 State St, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: The food at this place was amazing! But..... We did have to wait a very long time even though we made reservations. (2.5 hours)  We also received a parking ticket of a $50 fine for parking in the parking lot.( Which is my own fault for not noticing the sign, but I thought $50 was quite steep!)  I was told by an employee that they own the bank across the street and you can park there after business hours. But you might want to double check on that with them, because Salt Lake City loves to give out parking tickets!

I'm not big on sushi but they have a lot of other options that are delicious. Went with a big group & they were able to accommodate our party of 20. We made reservations as well. Everyone loved the sushi. Staff was great! Definitely recommend!

This is my favorite sushi location in SLC. I enjoy the ambiance and the service and the sushi is delicious. They are always accommodating, on one occasion switching out any tuna in our rolls for my breastfeeding sister-in-law. I will say that about 5-6 months ago they changed the number of pieces per roll from 8 to 7, removing one of the end pieces. I don't understand why, but everything else about it is so good! 

Note: recently, the large parking lot south of them changed from public parking to privately-owned, so it is a bit harder to find free parking around the establishment.

I find every excuse I can to come to Sapa, every special occasion! It is perfect in every way. No exaggeration. I have loved the bar addition next door the last couple years! Favorite sushi in SLC, best atmosphere and a great place to celebrate special occasions with your loved ones!

Stayed at the Grand America in Salt Lake and found this sushi place near by! Other than being slightly over priced the food was pretty good! Nothing overly fantastic or amazing, but the flavors worked very well together. Nothing I had tasted or smelled fishy wish was great. It's a good place and I would come here again, it's just that there wasn't anything super unique or different or amaIng about it compared to every other Americanized sushi place. Service was good too. Waiter was constantly topping us off and was super nice. Overall a good experience.

name: Porcupine Pub & Grille
address: 258 1300 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84102, USA
reviews: Probably the BEST service I have ever seen. My daughter's dance school came in mid competition on a deadline with a party of THIRTY and asked if it was possible to be seated and out quickly. The manager was confident and friendly and they had all 30 of us seated and out in and done in an hour. All order and checks correct! Food was fresh and portions were huge, servers were very friendly and accommodating. The manager even personally came by to bring extra salad dressing and check that everything was going okay! Definitely recommend.

Porcupine Pub & Grill is an old fire station converted into a pub. The interior has a great vibe.  We found the staff to be exceptional.  We were greeted by Sonny and he was happy to make a space for us on the patio.  Our server was knowledgeable and attentive.  The meals were great.  My order came out wrong, but they were quick to correct it without any fuss at all.  If there is a downside, it is lack of parking, but that is the case with all of the businesses in that area. Definitely recommend and will return.

This is the newer of the two Porcupines, a fresh decor and light surroundings on two floors, former location of Market Street Grill. Porcupine is one of local favorites and it has never disappointed. Food is good, the crowd is lively and the drink menu is above average. No reservations unles you have 16 or more, but you can call in advance to put your name on the list. It's close to theaters and gets packed from 530-730pm on play nights, be aware. Great patio for summer hangouts! Dinner for two - expect to spend $50-60 and leave with a smile on your face!

Went here for date night a few days ago and had a wonderful time. I believe our waiters name was, Chandler(?), and he did Amazing. The food was ok, nothing to boast about would give it a 4 out 5 stars for the food, but that was the best service I have had at a restaurant in a long time. I hope he enjoyed the 40% tip because he more than earned it. They have earned my business back based on their service. Thank you guys!!
I love the fact that it's very spacious. The food was good, as well. I just wish they had more parking spaces. Overall, I enjoyed it.

name: SLC Eatery
address: 1017 S Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: EAT HERE!  Oh buddy,  let me tell you this place is incredible.  Limited cocktail menu but delicious and lively.  Good wine selections and GREAT FOOD!  Everything we tried was delicious. I can't wait to return.

Cute place with a cool concept of cart service, which allows you to sample a variety of small dishes in addition to your entree. The service, food and drinks were great! There were a few dishes on the cart menu I was interested in trying, but didn’t get a chance to because they weren’t on the cart any of the times they came by. Would definitely recommend.

SLC Eatery is a super cute and chic place. We went here for brunch and was surprised that they had a dim sum inspired menu. Service was fast and we had a great waiter. We'll have to come back later and try their dinner menu as I've heard it's more new age American food.

Wow. No joke some of the best food I've had in SLC. Its original, inspired, and creative. The ambiance is mellow and welcoming. Service is fantastic. Food is very very good. It's not a great place for restricted diets as most of the meals contain and combine dairy and meat. Even if you drop by for the cart, drop by.
Had a small bachelorette party of nine catered by SLC Eatery and everything was amazing. The food, service and setup was all  absolutely perfect. Will definitely do this again!

name: Mahider Ethiopian Restaurant & Market
address: 1465 State St #7, Salt Lake City, UT 84115, USA
reviews:
As a Mexican I had never eaten Ethiopian food. This became an awesome experience! Staff was friendly and food had a great taste. I got the Mahider sampler and it had so many different tastes.

 Cost was 14 dollars for one person. It could feed two normal people. Eating with your hands came easy for me since I am used to tortillas. 

If you want more spice just ask when you order. All in all I will be going back with the wife.

Amazing restaurant where you get the experience of having Ethiopian food and know about the culture. We were four and we had the meal for four people. It was more than enough for us. We had the chance to try everything and the food was delicious. I will go again for sure. They also have store where you can buy Ethiopian groceries.

Mahider was more than just a restaurant, it was an experience! Our waiter was helpful and kind. The food was delicious and unique. If you haven't tried Ethiopian food, it is high time you did. Head over to Mahider for the best food and experience!

The food here is fantastic. I wish I lived close, so I could eat here more often. Get the Taste of Mahider. Friendly staff, huge portions and quality food for a great price. That's a rare combination that's worth the drive.
So special and traditional food. I love the flavor! They have several kinds of sour vegetables, soft bread, and smashed beans. Nice people there.

name: Cannella's
address: 204 E 500 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: Cannella's is a staple of Salt Lake City. My mom loved this place when she was in college and working in the city and now I love it too! Their salads are my favorite, and the specialty Cannella's salad is especially unique and delicious. Plus, their variety of drinks can't be beat. The atmosphere is modern yet cozy so it's perfect for dates, drinks, or dinner with the family. Overall, it's a great place to get some good Italian food and a taste of SLC.

Great food. Amazing staff. Can't wait to go back and try something else. I had the zucchini noodles and meatball. The meatball was huge and had the perfect texture and seasonings. The deep red marinara sauce was incredible. Brooklyn was the best!

Located on the corner 200 E and 500 S. This cozy Italian restaurant will tantalize your taste buds. The food was delicious and the staff very attentive. This place will become one of your favorite places for a wonderful dining experience.

Ordered the lasagna around 9:00pm (they close at 10:00) and something tasted off. The cheese was rubbery and seemed like it had been in a warming oven for awhile. Same with the meat. The server also admitted their bleu cheese “house” dressing was Kraft... for the price, you’d expect house made. Salad also had canned beets, again not a serious sin but I was expecting fresh ingredients. Maybe everything had been fresh the experience would have been better.

Cannella's is  a wonderful dinning experience. The dishes are wonderful and visually appealing. It has a bar, and there is alfresco dining in the of the restaurant. The service is quick and the staff is very knowledgeable. The deserts are wonderful.  It's a great time for your taste buds.

name: Blue Lemon | Salt Lake City
address: 55 W S Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: If you are looking for casual dining that almost feels fancy, this is the place. Food here is fresh and light. The sweet potato fries and sweet with a touch of salt. Highly recommend.  It's definitely busy. I'm not sure I like the order line, it feels like a fast food place, but everything looks classy and they bring your order to you. Food tastes great:) If you come during the holidays you get a gorgeous view of the Christmas lights out the large windows!

I heard a lot of good things about blue lemon. It was good food but nothing spectacular. I had the summer chicken Cesar and that was good. I also got a free appetizer by downloading the app. I would recommend doing that. It was a chili corn quest dip. It was good but I would have liked more green chili flavor. I would go back because it was different but it reminded me in many ways of Panera.

EDIT: I've returned a few times and also tried the Korean Style Beef-Rice Bowl. It was way good.

-Original Review- 
Very good. I got the Mediterranean salad with added salmon. Table service when the food is ready and bussing so you can get up and go when you're done. Very good, very convenient.

We had a great dinner at Blue Lemon this evening. It was packed when we got there, but the line moved quickly and several tables opened up for our large family. 
Our food was ready within five minutes, which we were pleasantly surprised about, given the amount of patrons. 
Everything was delicious. The adults, teens and kids all found menu items that appealed to them and enjoyed all of it.

I ordered a door dash from here. Everything was good except I found a long white string in my chicken BLT. I've tried to contact someone but no one picks up. Just wanted you to be aware of things like that.

name: The Other Place
address: 469 E 300 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: The Other Place is a great place for a hometown feel. I can't say for sure, but I would bet that they have regulars they know on a first name basis. The family who runs it is Greek, so they have a lot of Greek food choices mixed in with the American items. This is a traditional Greek style chicken (I can't remember what it was called) with spaghetti in their house sauce. I was expecting a tomato sauce like I have typically had on spaghetti,  but at the Other Place they put cinnamon in it. It was a little surprising at first, but I actually really enjoyed it. They are known for having really good breakfast food,  so I will have to try that next time.

Good food and great service!

Pros: 
-We had 12 people in our party and Manolis was our server and did an amazing job of serving us with a great sense of humor. 
- The lamb is SO good!
- The rice pudding was excellent and the baklava was heavenly!
- Accommodates large parties easily

Cons: 
- Can't think of anything!

I went here with my wife, and we both had a very positive experience. Our server was very helpful in giving us recommendations. While he was doing so, a regular customer told us that we could close our eyes and point to anything on the menu and be happy with it. I don't doubt that to be true. We ended up splitting a dinner, and it was enough food for both of us to feel satisfied. We're planning on returning. Good food, and great service.

Absolute gem. The portions were generous and delicious. The food came out fast and the service was quick and more than helpful. This was our first time going here and we will definitely be back. The pita was the best I've ever tasted. There is a parking lot in the back so you don't have to park on the street.

One of my favorite places in SLC! We try to come here whenever we're in town! Delicious food and great service. I love the special house salad with the marinaded chicken! I usually take a to go order of the chicken home for later! We have never had to wait to be seated and that works great for lunch when we are traveling!

name: Garage on Beck
address: 1199 Beck St, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA
reviews: This place is absolutely fantastic!  I  had lunch here with three work colleagues on JAN 23, and everything we ordered was phenomenal!  Amazing customer service.  You will not be disappointed!
Best food in Utah!!!! Amazing!!! Can’t say enough good things :) The funeral potato’s and 5 way burger are the best! A must try place. Parking is a challenge but well worth it

Hidden gem north of the downtown area.  Parking is a bit strange but the food and service is very good.  Live music is always nice.  Cool industrial vibes next to the oil refinery.  The wings are amazing!
Always a great staff. Even after the "incident" with the local band and the merch table. Can't recommend this place enough.

We came on a recommendation about their Sunday brunch...which it did not disappoint.  It opens at 1030am and was worth the wait.  Parking is very limited, so get there early.  There is plenty of seating around this grungy bar.  The look is authentic and the food is no joke.  Do yourself a favor and get the funeral potatoes.  You will not regret it.  The chicken and waffles is so much food you will take it home and the philly omelet was made with the whizz!  If you have to ask...you can't afford it.  The bloody Mary's are on point and I got a 5 gallon bucket of diet coke. Would live to go back if in town and try something new.

name: My Thai Asian Cuisine
address: 1425 S 300 W, Salt Lake City, UT 84115, USA
reviews: Awesome family friendly atmosphere!  The lady working (she is the daughter of the owners) was so helpful to me and went above and beyond when I told her I needed gluten free options.  Not only that, but this restaurant carries all gluten free soy sauce.  That is unheard of, but much appreciated.

Best Thai cooking in Utah! Delicious! Dee the owner is passionate about her love .. Cooking and making people happy! Love this place. Stop by for lunch she has a little Buffet where you can just choose a few items and eat for under $7 a plate it's wonderful! Great fresh food and good portions!

This is as close to authentic thai food as Utah gets! Ive been to a few Thai restaurants here, but this one stands out the most. Its a restaurant run by a Thai family, and an old Thai grandma is the one cooking. Prices are very reasonable, and I love the atmosphere of this place. Very friendly workers. I was not disappointed

Fresh ingredients, friendly fast service and friendly owner. Basil stir fry and pad Thai were we're good. Yellow curry was not my favorite, and that is usually my go to dish. Personal I am with says it's their favorite place. You may like it more than me but not where I'd go again for yellow curry. Reasonable prices.
Modest price, good tasty food & decent ambiance.

name: The Rose Establishment
address: 235 400 W, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: This is not your eggs & bacon breakfast place. This is your  Rise & Shine breakfast place. The second you walk in there, you can smell the fresh coffee beans and feel the good vibe. I totally recommend this place. Take a friend or come here by yourself. You will never be disappointed. Food has lots of flavour and it's very fresh. They serve Mimosa's too!

This is probably my favorite spot in Salt Lake for breakfast. The breakfast foods all have a creative spin on the classics: cinnamon rolls, cheese biscuits, scones, avocado toast, etc. the coffee is amazing...but let’s be honest, I usually indulge in the mimosas:) The patio is beautiful in the summer/spring. If you are new to Salt Lake, or haven’t tried this place yet, do it! Come for breakfast!

This is a great place, but not for everyone. The coffee is high, high quality, but the blends are very sweet and floral and not for people who really like bitter coffee. It's also always slammed in the morning, especially on weekends and it's a small place so not a lot of places to sit. Because of this, if you want a pour over it will take 15 minutes or more. With these things being said the food quality is amazing, the bread is some of the best bread in Utah and the tasted are great. Their avocado toasts are delicious and their sweets are good.

Fresh and delicious menu with great breakfast and snack options. I had the melon milk tea and the flavors were beautiful. Also stocked up for the road trip back to Denver with the blueberry cornbread and sweet roll, the cornmeal cookie, oatmeal cookie and pesto bun. Each of them were so yummy.

This is just a really great spot! The staff is knowledgeable and cool. There can often be a line, but they handle it well. The food is very tasty and the coffee is fantastic! The decor is authentic and simple which make it a comfortable place for a quick bite or longer stay.

name: Chile-Tepin
address: 307 W 200 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
reviews: I’ve seen it over and over again and the reviews but it is honestly true, this place is probably the best Mexican food I’ve had in Salt Lake. The price is also super reasonable. The meal cost $30 and was very filing! The atmosphere is also a clean modern place with friendly servers. Parking is the one thing that can sometimes be an issue here, we’ve had to park on the other side of the block and walk over but it isn’t too bad because there is a parking lot that you can walk across.

Was told the kitchen was backed up 45 minutes or so. OK cool I appreciate the heads up. Sat there for almost an hour and was brought water, chips, and salsa. NO ONE EVER CAME TO TAKE OUR DRINK OR FOOD ORDER!! I EVEN ASKED SOMEONE TO TAKE OUR ORDER AND WAS TOLD SHE WOULD BE RIGHT THERE. ANOTHER 10 MINUTES AND STILL NOTHING! My party of 3 gave up and left! Probably will not be back!!

One of my personal favorites! I can't count the times that I've dined there.  The food alone would bring me there; however the service is way-over-the -top!  Without a doubt one of the  top restaurants in Salt Lake City.  Very nice interior.  Just simply a great all around dining experience.  Go there and enjoy!!

Didn't get a chance to try the food because the online menu stinks sadly. I don't speak a lot of Spanish and the titles are in Spanish so I don't know what it is. Plus there's no pictures to show it or any kind of details on what is included or what options are available to you. Not until you click on ordering then you get an idea on what might come with it. It was highly recommended with its high pricing but guess the only way to find out is to call and see how that goes. And even then the phone call I made was very poor quality because I couldn't hear over the static.

Incredible. I am huge on the quality of service rendered to customers, and Chile Tepin delivered. The wait on the Saturday night that we went was about 45 minutes, but it was so worth it! The staff were all warm and friendly, the ambience of the restaurant was welcoming and the food was delicious. There was plenty of flavor and an authenticity in each dish. I especially loved the molcajete dish (good for 2 people) and the desserts. Churro cheesecake shown below is an intriguing, very rich flavor. I would have preferred a small bite of it rather than an entire slice, but really all the food was exceptional.

name: BOLTCUTTER
address: 57 E Gallivan Ave, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: This was our first time trying an all vegan restaurant and it was so good! The cauliflower wings alone are enough for us to come back again and again. But the burritos were amazing too! The server was very nice and it's clean. Really enjoyed this gem.

I guess I’m fortunate to have come here for the first time recently, loved the burrito and the nachos. It’s sometimes hard finding food plant based options and healthy can be a little bit more expensive which is a downside. However I guess you need less because there’s actually more nutrition, so better all the way around. The staff was friendly and food came out pretty quickly. I would eat here again and again . Thank you 😊
Came here during a short layover & enjoyed it. Food came out really quickly and the staff is nice. It is 100% vegan & very reasonable!
I ordered the quesadillas.  Ask for the hot sauce - delicious.  Restaurant is all vegan and an ice cream store next door that is all vegan too.  Had rocky road ice cream after a long time!
Great place to eat! Vegan friendly. The menu is simple, but everything I've had here has been delicious!

name: Sawadee (Utah) Thai Restaurant
address: 754 E S Temple St, Salt Lake City, UT 84102, USA
reviews: Most satisfying lunch I’ve ever had! The lunch special let’s you pick two types of courses, served with rice. The service was incredibly attentive and friendly. I would highly recommend this place. Looking forward to going back soon.

Nice atmosphere, great food, plenty of vegetarian options.  I had the lunch special which was a great price and very delicious. The decorations in the restaurant were nice.  There is parking outside with plenty of spaces which is great for the area.  Food was out quickly, there was no wait time and it was a pleasant experience overall.

The coconut soup with mushrooms and shrimp is amazing! Like the best in the Salt Lake valley. It is full of flavor and fresh ingredients! The green curry was also nice and had a good zing to it. The atmosphere was delightful and the lunch time special is a wonderful price for all the food and flavor you get. Highly recommend, and I will be back for the Pad Thai along with all the many drool inducing options. The guava candy at the end leaves you well pleased.

Sawadee is my favorite Thai restaurant in Salt Lake. I start craving their coconut soup as soon as I get anywhere near the area. Such great flavor. The curries are wonderful. I have not had a dish that disappoints.

Delicious Thai food! We had the yellow curry, pad Thai and pineapple fried rice. Finished with the delicious mango sticky rice, not pictured. Quality food. Large portions. Quality service. The waitresses, all the workers were friendly. After eating our meal, we ended up buying a full rectangular tray of pad Thai and a full rectangular tray of the pineapple fried rice for a birthday party the next day. Everyone loved the food! We are loyal customers now. We’ll be back again.

name: The Blue Plate Diner
address: 2041 S 2100 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84108, USA
reviews:
This place was hopping! 
As quickly as people left, people came in.. They have a routine that gets the jobs done quickly and efficiently.. I was impressed..
I got green tea/peppermint and the build your own omelette. There was plentiful of food and decent prices for what you get..
If I could give them 10 stars I would!

Fantastic restaurant overall!  Went for the first time while visiting friends.  Initial service was a little hit-or-miss (waiting for waitress) but once she arrived, service was great.  I ordered the waffle with home fries, which was amazing.  Instead of one waffle, you get two smaller ones that had a kind light icing around them.  Came with strawberries, whipped cream, and home fries.  The strawberries were amazingly fresh.  The home fries could've used more seasoning, but nothing that a bit of pepper didn't fix.  My wife ordered huevos rancheros, which she said were amazing.  All in all a relaxed place with a good menu and patio seating.

This is a very easy 5/5 for me. The service was fast and friendly, and the food was plentiful and delicious.

We got the hummus as an appetizer, and it came with deliciously soft pita. The Corned Beef Hash was excellent on its own, but it also came with perfectly light and fluffy scrambled eggs and some seriously tasty toast.

Easy recommend. We're already planning on bringing our extended family here next month when they visit.

The service was quick and the staff friendly. 

The food was hot and tasted fresh. I liked it and loved that they offer breakfast all day. The pancakes were so good. I love pancakes and highly recommend theirs. 

Make sure to pay attention to the art on the walls. Their are some fun ones displayed.

Enjoyed the food and location. Major issue for our visit was that we ordered lasagna which ended up being spicy, my wife wasn't able to eat it but was still charged for half of it (she had eaten the bread, salad and steamed veggies so I can understand where they are coming from, but that is something I don't agree with personally). My food was tasty and the portions were great, just had an overall "OK" time.

name: Taco Taco
address: 208 500 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: Taco's are super delicious! So much flavor! Everything on the menu is delicious. Only downfall is they don't have a soda/juice machine for refills on beverages.

Locally owned, friendly taco joint that serves up a lot of flavor.  I would recommend visiting if you find yourself in beautiful SLC.  Any place that has a salsa bar is already scoring high for me, compound that with great tacos and friendly atmosphere.  winner winner!

Perfect portions, quick service and a salsa bar. 

When you walk in you order right at the register. All of the tacos are base models and you finish them yourself at the salsa bar located in the next room. I can see this taking the guess work out of making choices as far as menu items are concerned. If you don't like onions, don't put them on your taco. Or, if you like pickles and don't like onions but are curious to try pickled onions, just throw a couple on the side of your plate and sample a couple. Water is self serve and it was ice cold for my visit.

I will say that the sides are bare bones too. The rice and beans could have used a little S&P. But that is a very minor gripe. 

Overall a good place that will fill you up but wont break the bank.

Taco Taco was a very cute restaurant with a fun vibe. The tacos were quite good and there were a few different salsas that could be added. The tacos al pastor were not exactly what I expected but I still enjoyed them a lot!

Awesome food!
Gavin is seriously a fantastic hire. He was extremely helpful to an elderly man who was there eating by himself. Super cool to see staff that goes the extra mile taking care of every customer.

name: Alamexo
address: 268 State St #110, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
reviews: This place has some of the best Mexican food in Utah. It’s high quality food that tastes amazing. It’s a great experience that I highly recommend. I loved the guacamole, salsas, chip, tacos, enchiladas, pretty much everything. It is right in the heart of Salt Lake, so parking is limited. The ambience was cool and elegant. The service was spectacular. It’s very clean and beautiful. I would recommend visiting outside of rush hours. You cannot go wrong here. The only downside is it is a bit expensive.

this hidden gem is located on state street in salt lake and let me tell you it is top notch.. a little gourmet ‘Tex-Mex’ fine dining experience over delivers and did not disappoint myself as well as all my mates.. Named Alamexo, this fine restaurant is play on words that pays homage to the historical event known as the Alamo.  Honestly the perfect name for such an eatery with strong theming to make you feel as though you are transported to the actual Alamo itself.. The servers are extraordinarily personable and quick.. the food amazing.. take an extra step beyond the complimentary chips and salsa and order the guacamole, the server prepares it right in front of you and it’s like nothing you’ve ever had before.. after the main course they surprised our table with an extra treat on the house and it made the night that much better.. phenomenal experience

You'll spend a ton of money for ho hum Mexican food. I've never even heard of burritos and tacos being that expensive, MAYBE if you had a few Michelin stars you could get away with it. I mean around the corner is a taco truck with awesome al pastor burritos for $5.
I really love this Mexican restaurant in downtown Salt Lake. I think I might be one of the best Mexican restaurants in the City.

The decorations in the restaurant were really cool and set the mood well, but they seemed under-staffed and our server wasn’t very good. Their prices are way too high for the amount of food you get. You pay for the arrangement of food on the plate it seemed like. Will not go back, but the food was pretty good!

name: Hires Big H
address: 425 700 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84102, USA
reviews:
Love this place. Really good food and it looks great inside. 

Price is comparable to others and they are open for take-out during Covid19 situation going on. Drive up in your car and they’ll come out and take your order.

The burgers are great but unfortunately besides that, everything else is sub par. The fries are similar to those of five guys and the onion rings just tasted like cornmeal. The restaurant itself is clean and nostalgic. We had to wait much longer than usual because they forgot our order. The waitress came back  twenty minutes later and reintroduced herself and asked if we were ready to order though we already have her our order 20 minutes prior. But even with all that we enjoyed our meal. Though it may be a bit till we come back around.

Best burgers in the WORLD!

Nick "Twelves" and Leilani go over and above, which is unusual in this day and age. The service and food is always top notch. The car hop service is a charming throwback and actually very functional in this bizarre social distancing time. We love love love this place because of the people who work there ❤️

We had a little issue with a slice of pineapple on our cheeseburger but besides that it was good. Grilled hit dog with cheese was great! Average fries but pretty good onion rings. For a burger joint you could do a lot worse.

I love this place. I look for excuses to go to Salt Lake City just so I can come here. The food is so good, the service is great, and the portions are huge. Their onion rings are pretty good, but I recommend their fries. They have bomb fry sauce too.
